revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Gustavs Ērenpreis | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{Birth date|1891|9|5|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Mazsalaca]], [[Latvia]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1956|05|19|1891|9|5|df=y}} | death_place = [[West Germany]] | nationality = [[Latvia]]n | other_names = | known_for = Recipient of the [[Order of the Three Stars]] and [[Cross of Recognition]] | education = | employer = | occupation = | home_town = | title = | salary = | height = | weight = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = | boards = | religion = | spouse = | partner = | children = | parents = | relatives = | signature = | footnotes = }} '''Gustavs Ērenpreis''' (5 September 1891 – 19 May 1956) was a Latvian-born manufacturer of [[bicycles]] best known as recipient of the [[Order of the Three Stars]] and [[Cross of Recognition]], and as a founder and director of [[Gustavs Ērenpreis Bicycle Factory]], which in the 1930s was the largest manufacturer of bicycles in the Baltic states. Ērenpreis's bicycles were ridden by a generation of elite bicycle racers in [[Latvia]]. == Personal life == Gustavs Ērenpreis was the son of [[Mazsalaca Manor|Valtenberģi Manor]] coachman Lībijs and Anna. He was born in Vatenberģi (today, Mazsalaca city), [[Latvia]] which at that time was in the [[Russian Empire]]. Ērenpreis was educated at a trade school in [[Riga]].
He was married twice and had one child from the first marriage - a son Jānis, and four children from the second marriage - a son Juris and three daughters - Anita, Maija and Sarmīte.''Being happy for success of the relative/ Ar prieku par radinieka veikumu''. Interview with the son of Gustavs Ērenpreis, Andris Tiļļa. Latvijas Avīze, 17 April 2012, p. 5. Retrieved 08 December 2015 Gustavs Ērenpreis was decorated with the [[Order of the Three Stars]] medal,''Recipients of the Order of the Three Stars''/ "Ar Triju zvaigžņu ordeni apbalvoto saraksts" (17 November 1937). Government Gazette/ Valdības Vēstnesis, Nr. 262, published Rīgā, castle nr.2, pp. 2. Retrieved 04 December 2015. List available in [http://www.periodika.lv/ periodika.lndb.lv] - Latvian National Digital Library the highest order of the Republic of Latvia, and the [[Cross of Recognition]]''Appreciation for work/ Atzinība krietnam darba veicējam,'' (17 December 1938). Darba Dzīve, Nr.32, pp. 3. Retrieved 04 December 2015. Article available in [http://www.periodika.lv/ periodika.lndb.lv] - Latvian National Digital Library of the Republic of Latvia. After the nationalization of the bicycle USSR, Gustavs emigrated to West Germany where he worked in sawmill.Liepiņš Edvīns and Seregins Jānis, ''From Leutner to Erenpreis: 100 Years of Bicycle Manufacturing in Latvia''. Industrial Heritage Trust of Latvia, 2009; pp. 99-107. {{ISBN|9789934805004}} He never returned to his homeland Latvia and died after an illness in [[Detmold]], [[Germany]]. He was buried in [[Augsdorf]].''Foreigner Latvians/ Latvieši pasaulē'' (14 July 1956). The Australian Latvian, Nr.344, pp. 2. Retrieved 04 December 2015. List available in [http://www.periodika.lv/ periodika.lndb.lv] - Latvian National Digital Library == Career == After graduation of trade school in Riga, in 1907 he worked at the Eduards Bērziņš bicycle workshop in [[Riga]], which produced bicycles and repaired and sold English [[Triumph Engineering|Triumph]] and [[Douglas (motorcycles)|Douglas]] motorcycles in the [[Baltic states]]. During [[World War I]] he was evacuated with the workshop to [[Harkov]]. After the war the workshop equipment could not be recovered, and Gustavs had to return to Riga, Latvia without any equipment. In 1921, following the end of the war, Ērenpreis launched his own workshop, where in early years he repaired and sold abandoned [[military transport]]s of the [[West Russian Volunteer Army|Bermont army]]. He moved into manufacturing the following year as the "G. Ērenpreis Motorcycle and Bicycle Workshop", where he first manufactured his own bicycles under the "Baltija" label. Due to rapid expansion, the limited space in his workshop had become a problem, and in 1924 the Ērenpreis workshop moved to a larger space. In 1926 Gustavs Ērenpreis and his business partners established a [[joint-stock company]] called Omega, but this entity was ultimately abandoned that same year. === G. Ērenpreis Bicycle Factory === Those first manufacturing efforts were preliminary to the actual establishment of a new manufacturing entity called the G. Ērenpreis Bicycle Factory in 1927. The new firm continued in its previous quarters until, in 1931, construction began on a new, modern bicycle factory located on in Brīvības Street. Janis Seregins, the biggest bicycle collection owner in Baltics and the author of historic review of Latvian bicycle history "100 year of bicycle manufacturing in Latvia. From Leutner to Erenpreis" points out that by 1937 the factory had become the largest manufacturer of bicycles in the Baltic states. In addition to being the largest Latvian bicycle manufacture of its day, the G. Ērenpreis bicycle factory was regarded as the source of the highest quality bikes for Latvian competitive cyclists.[http://www.delfi.lv/sports/news/tautassports/news/latvijas-ritenbrauceju-vienibas-brauciens-toreiz-un-tagad.d?id=39999993 "Vienības brauciens – toreiz un tagad" (The Unity Ride - then and now)], the story of historic bicycle race in Latvia. Delfi, August 8, 2011. Accessed: February 19, 2015. G. Ērenpreis bicycles were ridden by the top Latvian cyclists of the era, including [[Olympic games|Olympic]] cyclists [[Arvīds Immermanis]] and [[Andrejs Apsītis]].[http://olimpiade.lv/lv/latvijas-olimpiesi/arvids-immermanis-231?ref=%3Fq%3Dimmermanis Arvīds Immermanis - Latvian Olympic], Official home page of [[Latvian Olympic Committee]]. Accessed February 19, 2015. === Nationalization of factory and legacy === Unfortunately, [[World War II]] and the [[occupation of Latvia]] halted G. Ērenpreis bicycle factory work. The Ērenpreis company was [[nationalization|nationalized]] by the USSR and renamed the "Red Star Riga Bicycle Factory" (Rīgas Velosipēdu rūpnīca (RVR) "Sarkanā Zvaigzne"). Bicycle production continued at that company until 1963, when the factory was retooled and converted to the production of [[mopeds]]. Today G. Ērenpreis bicycles are exhibited at the [[Riga Motor Museum]] as part of the country's industrial heritage.[http://www.motormuzejs.lv/pub/index.php?lang=eng&id=243 Made in Latvia - automobiles, bicycles and mopeds], www.motormuzejs.lv. Accessed 04 December 2015 Starting in 2011, Gustavs hometown Mazsalaca has celebrated Gustavs Ērenpreis birthday in the festival "Velosvētki - Ērenpreisam 124" (bicycle festival - Ērenpreiss - 124 years old!")[http://www.mazsalaca.lv/index.php?zoomzina=362&title=Velosv%C4%93tki+%26%2334%3B%C4%92renpreisam+124%26%2334%3B Velosvētki "Ērenpreisam 124"]. 20 June 2015. Accessed 04 December 2015 In 2012 the brand was revived by Gustavs Ērenpreis' great grandnephew, Toms Ērenpreiss, who manufactures new [[Ērenpreiss Bicycles|Ērenpreiss bicycles]].[https://www.theguardian.com/environment/bike-blog/2015/may/06/the-bike-brand-that-helped-latvia-rediscover-its-cycling-heritage ''The bike brand that helped Latvia rediscover its cycling heritage''] by Emily Chappell, 06 May 2015. The Guardian. Retrieved on 07 March 2016 == References == {{Reflist|30em}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Erenpreis, Gustavs}} [[Category:Latvian businesspeople]] [[Category:1891 births]] [[Category:1956 deaths]] [[Category:Cycle manufacturers of Latvia]] [[Category:Recipients of the Cross of Recognition]]

{{Infobox person | name = Henry Regnery | image = | image_size = | caption = | birth_name = | birth_date = {{birth date|1912|1|5}} | birth_place = [[Hinsdale, Illinois]] | death_date = {{death date and age|1996|6|18|1912|1|5}} | death_place = [[Chicago, Illinois]], U.S. | death_cause = | resting_place = | resting_place_coordinates = | residence = | nationality = | other_names = | known_for = | education = | alma mater = | employer = | occupation = Publisher | title = | salary = | networth = | term = | predecessor = | successor = | party = | boards = | religion = | spouse = | children = [[Alfred S. Regnery]] | parents = [[William H. Regnery]]
Francis Susan Thrasher | relatives = }} '''Henry Regnery''' (January 5, 1912 – June 18, 1996) was an [[Americans|American]] [[publisher]].[http://www.nndb.com/people/889/000133490/ NNDB webpage]Robert McG. Thomas Jr, 'Henry Regnery, 84, Ground-Breaking Conservative Publisher', in ''[[The New York Times]]'', June 23, 1996 [https://www.nytimes.com/1996/06/23/us/henry-regnery-84-ground-breaking-conservative-publisher.html]Jeffrey O. Nelson, 'Henry Regnery: Missionary of Culture', in ''The Intercollegiate Review'', Fall 1996, pp.14–22[http://www.firstprinciplesjournal.com/articles.aspx?article=891&theme=home&loc=b First Principles Journal biography] ==Early life== Henry Regnery was born on January 5, 1912http://www.encyclopedia.com/article-1G2-2874700239/regnery-henry.html in [[Hinsdale, Illinois]], the next to youngest of five children of Frances Susan Thrasher and William Henry Regnery, a wealthy textile manufacturer.[http://www.chilit.org/Histories/Regnery%20bio.htm Chicago Literary Club biography]http://www.firstprinciplesjournal.com/articles.aspx?article=891 He obtained a degree in [[mechanical engineering]] from [[MIT]] in 1934, and an M.A. from [[Harvard University]], where he worked with [[Joseph Schumpeter]]. He also studied at [[Illinois Institute of Technology|Armour Institute of Technology]], and from 1934 to 1936 at the [[University of Bonn]]. Shortly after, he became a member of the [[America First Committee]]. ==Career== Regnery financed the creation of ''[[Human Events]]'' in 1944. His publishing company, the Henry Regnery Company, now known as [[Regnery Publishing]], would go on to publish two conservative classics, [[William F. Buckley]]'s ''[[God and Man at Yale]]'' (1951) and [[Russell Kirk]]'s ''[[Russell Kirk#The Conservative Mind|The Conservative Mind]]'' (1953). ==Philanthropy== Regnery was a member of the [[American Conservatory of Music]] and the [[Chicago Literary Club]]. He was a trustee of [[Shimer College]] in the early 1960s.{{Cite news|work=Shimer College Record|volume=52|issue=4|date=December 1960|title=Board of Trustees}} Regnery was the president of the [[Philadelphia Society]].[http://phillysoc.org/presiden.htm The Philadelphia Society] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100223102538/http://phillysoc.org/presiden.htm |date=2010-02-23 }} ==Death and legacy== Regnery died in Chicago on June 18, 1996, of complications of brain surgery.[[Robert McG. Thomas|Thomas Jr., Robert McG.]], [https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9401E7D91539F930A15755C0A960958260 "Henry Regnery, 84, Ground-Breaking Conservative Publisher"], obituary, ''[[The New York Times]]'', June 23, 2007. His papers are kept at the [[Hoover Institution]] at [[Stanford University]].http://www.oac.cdlib.org/findaid/ark:/13030/kt9v19q4s4 His son is lawyer, author and publisher [[Alfred S. Regnery]].[http://www.isi.org/bios/bio.aspx?id=0DFEF389-6F55-4D7D-B58A-77F7527111C9&source=General&select=true&detail=1 Intercollegiate Studies Institute biography] ==Bibliography== *''Creative Chicago: From the Chap-Book to the University'' *''[[Cliff Dwellers Club|The Cliff Dwellers]]: The History of a Chicago Cultural Institution'' *''Memoirs of a Dissident Publisher'' ==References== {{reflist}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Regnery, Henry}} [[Category:1912 births]] [[Category:1996 deaths]] [[Category:American people of German descent]] [[Category:Massachusetts Institute of Technology alumni]] [[Category:University of Bonn alumni]] [[Category:Harvard University alumni]] [[Category:American publishers (people)]] [[Category:American Roman Catholics]] [[Category:Businesspeople from Chicago]] [[Category:Human Events people]] [[Category:Philadelphia Society members]] [[Category:New Right (United States)]] [[Category:People from Hinsdale, Illinois]] [[Category:20th-century American businesspeople]] [[Category:Regnery family]] [[Category:Catholics from Illinois]]

revision.comment: /* List of Indian Accounting Standards{{Cite web|url=http://www.mca.gov.in/MinistryV2/Stand.html|title=Ministry Of Corporate Affairs - Indian Accounting Standards|website=www.mca.gov.in|language=en|access-date=2017-01-21}} */
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2016}} {{Use Indian English|date=January 2016}} {{refimprove|date=June 2016}} {{Accounting}}
'''Indian Accounting Standard '''(abbreviated as '''Ind-AS''') is the [[Accounting standard]] adopted by companies in India and issued under the supervison of Accounting Standards Board (ASB) which was constituted as a body in the year 1977. ASB is a committee under [[Institute of Chartered Accountants of India]] (ICAI) which consists of representatives from government department, academicians, other professional bodies viz. ICAI, representatives from ASSOCHAM, CII, FICCI, etc.
The Ind AS are named and numbered in the same way as the [[International Financial Reporting Standards]] (IFRS). [[National Advisory Committee on Accounting Standards]] (NACAS) recommend these standards to the [[Ministry of Corporate Affairs (India)|Ministry of Corporate Affairs]] (MCA). MCA has to spell out the accounting standards applicable for companies in India. As on date MCA has notified 41 Ind AS. This shall be applied to the companies of financial year 2015-16 voluntarily and from 2016-17 on a mandatory basis.
Based on the international consensus, the regulators will separately notify the date of implementation of Ind-AS for the banks, insurance companies etc. Standards for the computation of Tax has been notified as ICDS in February 2015.<ref>{{cite web|title=Indian Accounting Standards Converged with IFRS Notified|url=http://pib.nic.in/newsite/erelease.aspx?relid=70248|publisher=Press Information Bureau }}</ref>
==History== India followed accounting standards from Indian Generally Acceptable Accounting Principle (IGAAP) prior to adoption of the Ind-AS.<ref name=et0716>{{citation |title=How new accounting standards will impact Indian companies |url=http://m.economictimes.com/markets/stocks/policy/how-new-accounting-standards-will-impact-indian-companies/articleshow/53200549.cms |work=[[The Economic Times]] |date=14 July 2016 }}</ref><ref name=et0416>{{citation |title=Ind-AS to raise June quarter tax liabilities by 20% |url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2016-04-13/news/72294894_1_new-accounting-standards-value-accounting-ind-as |work=[[The Economic Times]] |date=13 April 2016 }}</ref>
==Applicability<ref name="et0716" /><ref name="et0416" /><ref name="bs0516">{{citation |title=Ind AS requires 3,000 disclosures for fair picture of cos |url=http://www.business-standard.com/article/pti-stories/ind-as-requires-3-000-disclosures-for-fair-picture-of-cos-116052400998_1.html |work=[[Business Standard]] |date=24 May 2016 }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://mca.gov.in/Ministry/pdf/Notification_20022015.pdf|title=Company (Inaian Accounting Standard) Rules, 2015|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref>== Companies shall follow Ind AS either Voluntarily or Mandatorily. Once a company follows Indian AS, either mandatorily or voluntarily, it can't revert to old method of Accounting.
=== Mandatory Applicability (1 April 16) * Every Company with Net worth of not less than 500 crores (5 billion).
=== Mandatory Applicability from Accounting Period beginning on or after 1st April 2017 === * Every Listed Company. * Unlisted Companies with Net worth greater than or equal to Rs. 250 crore (2.5 billion) but less than Rs. 500 crore (5 billion)(for any of the below mentioned periods).
Net worth shall be checked for the previous four Financial Years (2013-14, 2014-15, 2015-16, and 2016-17)
== List of Indian Accounting Standards<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.mca.gov.in/MinistryV2/Stand.html|title=Ministry Of Corporate Affairs - Indian Accounting Standards|website=www.mca.gov.in|language=en|access-date=2017-01-21}}</ref> == {| class="wikitable sortable" !Ind As No. !Name of Indian Accounting Standard |- |Ind AS 101 |First-time adoption of Ind AS |- |Ind AS 102 |Share Based payments |- |Ind AS 103 |Business Combination |- |Ind AS 104 |Insurance Cont |- |Ind AS 105 |Non-Current Assets Held for Sale and Discontinued Operations |- |Ind AS 106 |Exploration for and Evaluation of Mineral Resources |- |Ind AS 107 |Financial Instruments: Disclosures |- |Ind AS 108 |Operating Segments |- |Ind AS 109 |Financial Instruments |- |Ind AS 110 |Consolidated Financial Statements |- |Ind AS 111 |Joint Arrangements |- |Ind AS 112 |Disclosure of Interests in Other Entities |- |Ind AS 113 |Fair Value Measurement |- |Ind AS 114 |Regulatory Deferral Accounts |- |Ind AS 115 |Revenue from Contracts with Customers |- |Ind AS 1 |Presentation of Financial Statements |- |Ind AS 2 |Inventories Accounting |- |Ind AS 7 & in only AS 3 |Statement of Cash Flows |- |Ind AS 8 |Accounting Policies, Changes in Accounting Estimates and Errors |- |Ind AS 10 |Events after Reporting Period |- |Ind AS 11 |Construction Contracts |- |Ind AS 12 |Income Taxes |- |Ind AS 16 |Property, Plant and Equipment |- |Ind AS 17 |Leases |- |Ind AS 18 |Revenue Recognition |- |Ind AS 19 |Employee Benefits |- |Ind AS 20 |Accounting for Government Grants and Disclosure of Government Assistance |- |Ind AS 21 |The Effects of Changes in Foreign Exchange Rates |- |Ind AS 23 |Borrowing Costs |- |Ind AS 24 |Related Party Disclosures |- |Ind AS 27 |Separate Financial Statements |- |Ind AS 28 |Investments in Associates and Joint Ventures |- |Ind AS 29 |Financial Reporting in Hyper inflationary Economies |- |Ind AS 32 |Financial Instruments: Presentation |- |Ind AS 33 |Earnings per Share |- |Ind AS 34 |Interim Financial Reporting |- |Ind AS 36 |Impairment of Assets |- |Ind AS 37 |Provisions, Contingent Liabilities and Contingent Assets |- |Ind AS 38 |Intangible Assets |- |Ind AS 40 |Investment Property |- |Ind AS 41 |Agriculture |}
==Provisions== Ind-AS is in line with the [[International Financial Reporting Standards]] (IFRS).<ref>{{citation |title=Corporates put restructuring, mergers, de-mergers within organisation on hold |url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/company/corporate-trends/corporates-put-restructuring-mergers-de-mergers-within-organisation-on-hold/articleshow/52468276.cms |work=[[The Economic Times]] |date=27 May 2016 }}</ref>
Ind-AS 107 deals with disclosures related to financial instruments and related risks and the policies for managing such risks.<ref name=bs0516/>
==See also== * [[Nepal Financial Reporting Standards]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
[[Category:Accounting standards]] [[Category:Accounting in India]] [[Category:Accounting principles by country]] [[Category:Indian standards|Acc]]
{{India-stub}}

revision.comment: Added {{[[Template:no footnotes|no footnotes]]}} tag to article ([[WP:TW|TW]])
/* Family */ his daughters are twins, changed the text to show that.
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox person |name = John Fredriksen |image = Stelios meeting1989.jpg |caption = Fredriksen (centre) and [[Stelios Haji-Ioannou]] (far left) at a meeting in 1989. |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1944|5|10}} |birth_place = [[Eidsvoll]], Norway |death_date = |death_place = |residence = London, England |nationality = [[Cyprus|Cypriot]] |other_names = |spouse = |known_for = Owner of [[Golden Ocean Group]]
Owner of [[Deep Sea Supply]]
Shareholder of [[Overseas Shipholding Group]] |net_worth = US$7.4 billion (April 2018){{cite news|title=John Fredriksen|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/john-fredriksen/|publisher=Forbes}} |alma_mater = |occupation = [[Business magnate]] |website = }} '''John Fredriksen''' (born 10 May 1944) is a Norwegian-born [[oil tanker]] and [[shipping]] [[Business magnate|magnate]], who owns the world's largest oil tanker fleet. He also has major interests in the [[offshore drilling|offshore driller]] [[Seadrill]], the [[fish farming]] company [[Marine Harvest]], the dry bulk company [[Golden Ocean Group]], and the [[Platform supply vessel|supply vessel]] company [[Deep Sea Supply]]. Through his investment companies [[Hemen Holdings]] and [[Meisha]], Fredriksen controls the companies [[Frontline Ltd|Frontline]] and [[Golar LNG]]. In 2010–2011, Frontline owned 9.6 percent of another large tanker company, [[Overseas Shipholding Group]].Bjørn Haugan, Johann D. Sundberg, [[Lars Magne Sunnanå]]: ''Flytter for døtrene'' (E24. 11 May 2006) [http://e24.no/boers-og-finans/article1312209.ece] North Atlantic Drilling, Sevan Drilling, and Asia Offshore Drilling are partly owned by Seadrill.{{cite web|url=http://seekingalpha.com/article/2852576-understanding-seadrills-complicated-financial-structure-the-asset-side?auth_param=10rf:1acen5e:5a48e21493fc93671a63d0154564ea50&uprof=45|title=Understanding Seadrill's Complicated Financial Structure: The Asset Side|first=Power|last=Hedge|date=27 January 2015|publisher=}} Born in [[Oslo]], Norway, Fredriksen is a [[Cypriot passport|Cypriot citizen]] who resides in London.{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2013/mar/18/super-rich-made-cyprus-home|title=The super-rich who have made Cyprus their home|first=Simon|last=Bowers|date=18 March 2013|publisher=|via=www.theguardian.com}}{{cite web|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/john-fredriksen-richest-man-in-cyprus-2013-3|title=The Richest Person In Cyprus Is Actually Norwegian|publisher=}} Before abandoning his Norwegian citizenship, he was Norway's richest man.De Lange, Grete. [http://www.aftenposten.no/english/business/article1314163.ece ''Norway's richest man no longer''] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070808041748/http://www.aftenposten.no/english/business/article1314163.ece |date= 8 August 2007 }} (Aftenposten. 11 May 2006) Norwegian magazine ''[[Finansavisen|Kapital]]'' listed Fredriksen in 2013 with a net worth of [[Norwegian krone|NOK]] 69,75 billion ({{US$}}11.9 billion).{{cite web|title=Kapital 400|url=http://www.hegnar.no/bors/article705549.ece|accessdate=3 May 2013}} In 2012, he was included in the [[50 Most Influential (Bloomberg Markets ranking)|50 Most Influential]] list of [[Bloomberg Markets]] Magazine. He was named in the top 10 most influential people in the shipping industry according to Lloyds List 2014.{{cite web|url=http://www.lloydslist.com/ll/news/top100/article452967.ece|title=10. John Fredriksen, Seatankers|date=12 December 2014|publisher=}} == Biography == === Family === Fredriksen was born on 10 May 1944 to a welder and his wife, and grew up in Etterstad in the eastern half of [[Oslo]]. Fredriksen is a widower and has two twin daughters: Cecilie and [[Kathrine Fredriksen|Kathrine Astrup Fredriksen]] (both born 1983). Fredriksen's former wife, dentist Inger Astrup Fredriksen (died 2006), originally belonged to one of the Astrup families in Norway. Her father was a professor of psychiatry, and her grand uncle was the painter [[Nikolai Astrup]]. === Business === Fredriksen made his fortune during the [[Iran–Iraq War]] in the 1980s, when his tankers picked up oil at great risk and huge profits. As described by his biographer, "he was the lifeline to the [[Ayatollah]]." Fredriksen would later become the world's largest tanker owner, with more than seventy oil tankers and major interests in oil rigs and fish farming. His fleet is dominated by costly double-hulled, environmentally safer tankers.{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/christopherhelman/2012/03/21/how-shipping-king-john-fredriksen-found-a-port-in-the-storm/|title=How Shipping King John Fredriksen Found A Port In The Storm|first=Christopher|last=Helman|work=Forbes}} In 2006, Seadrill bought more than 50 percent of [[Smedvig]], gaining control of the company (51.24 percent of the votes and 52.27 percent of the capital). Smedvig is Fredriksen's biggest ever deal. Noble Corp sold its stake to Seadrill in 2009, leaving Seadrill with full control.Nina Berglund [http://www.aftenposten.no/english/business/article1266407.ece Smedvig now fully under Fredriksen's control] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110629155723/http://www.aftenposten.no/english/business/article1266407.ece |date=29 June 2011}} ''Aftenposten''; 3 April 2006 Fredriksen has been the majority owner of [[Vålerenga Fotball|Vålerenga I.F.]] for many years.{{Citation needed|date=April 2015}} === Fortune === The ''[[Sunday Times Rich List]]'' has ranked Fredriksen's wealth as £475m (2003), £1.050b (2004) and £1.887b (2005). In 2012, Fredriksen and his family were listed as the 9th richest in Britain with a combined wealth of £6.6bn.{{cite news |title=Sunday Times Rich List shows UK's wealthiest defy recession|author=|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-17883101|newspaper=[[BBC News Online]]|date=28 April 2012|accessdate=28 April 2012}} Fredriksen owns houses in London, Oslo, Cyprus, and [[Marbella]], Spain. His house [[56 Old Church Street|The Old Rectory]] in London has been estimated to be worth around US$172 million.{{cite web|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/shipping-magnate-john-fredriksen-sticks-to-his-gut-feeling-invest/2012/09/21/0432903c-00dc-11e2-b260-32f4a8db9b7e_story.html|title=Shipping magnate John Fredriksen sticks to his ‘gut feeling’: Invest|first1=Edward|last1=Robinson|first2=Michelle Wiese|last2=Bockmann|date=22 September 2012|publisher=|accessdate=14 March 2018|via=www.washingtonpost.com}} He is a collector of classic Norwegian art.{{cite web|url=http://www.bornrich.com/john-fredriksen.html|title=John Fredriksen - Bornrich|date=29 May 2012|publisher=}} === Philanthropy === Fredriksen supports research projects at [[Norwegian Radium Hospital|Radium Hospital]]{{cite web|url=http://ous-research.no/dgo/|title=Dept. of Gyn. Oncology - Cancer Medicine - Divisions - Oslo University Hospital Research|website=ous-research.no}} and has donated several hundreds of millions of Norwegian kroner to medical research at hospitals in Norway.{{cite web|url=http://www.tradewindsnews.com/weekly/337168/messenger-boy-who-became-a-shipping-billionaire|title=Messenger boy who became a shipping billionaire|date=9 May 2014|publisher=}} === ''Gard'' case === In 1985, the Norwegian insurance company [[Assuranceforeningen Gard|Gard]] became suspicious about losses of cargo from Fredriksen's tankers. A private investigation was initiated, and a system for the use of heavy oil as bunker fuel was revealed.«For Oslo-advokatene ble Gisvolds reise slutten på den hemmelige etterforskningen. Man hadde nok, og dessuten var det nå bare et tidsspørsmål før Fredriksen fikk kjennskap til granskningen. Følgelig torde man ikke holde på lenger. Juristene anbefalte Gard å gå til politiet med sine mistanker.», fra Storeulv, side 106 The case was turned over to the Norwegian police and in June 1986 Fredriksen's offices in Oslo were searched and several of his nearest associates, and after a while also Fredriksen, were placed in detention while the case was investigated.«Samme morgen ble de seks arresterte fremstilt for Oslo forhørsrett. Siktelsen var grove oljetyverier og forsikringssvindel for cirka en million kroner.», fra Storeulv, side 125 After several years of arguments between the various lawyers, the case was settled out of court. Fredriksen had to pay a fine of 2 million NOK«John Fredriksen måtte i 1990 godta en bot på to millioner kroner for å ha satt mannskapenes liv i fare ved å bruke olje fra lasten som drivstoff.», fra Storeulv, side 168 for risking his crew's lives, and in addition had to pay the insurance company Gard an amount of over {{US$}}800,000.«Fredriksen aksepterte å betale Gard 800,000-dollar, pluss halvparten av den Marine Management-konto de hadde tatt beslag i.», fra Storeulv, side 160 == References == {{reflist|30em}} == Literature == * Hauge, Odd Harald and Gunnar Stavrum. ''Storeulv, en uautorisert biografi om John Fredriksen''. Oslo: Gyldendal, 2005. {{ISBN|978-82-05-35346-6}}. Print. == External links == *[http://www.lloydslist.com/ll/news/article413306.ece Lloyd's List 100 most Influential People in Shipping] {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Fredriksen, John}} [[Category:1944 births]] [[Category:Cypriot billionaires]] [[Category:Cypriot businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Norwegian billionaires]] [[Category:Norwegian businesspeople in shipping]] [[Category:Norwegian businesspeople]] [[Category:Norwegian emigrants to Cyprus]] [[Category:People from Oslo]] [[Category:Norwegian people of Danish descent]] [[Category:Cypriot people of Danish descent]]

{{multiple issues| {{original research|date=December 2015}} {{More citations needed|date=February 2010}} }} {{Infobox Radio station | name = KYCR | image = File:KYCR am1440 logo.jpg | city = [[Golden Valley, Minnesota]] | area = [[Minneapolis-St. Paul]] | branding = ''Twin Cities Business Radio'' | slogan = | airdate = May 1948 (as KEYD) | frequency = 1440 [[kHz]] | format = [[Business journalism|Business]] [[Talk radio|Talk]] | power = 5,000 [[watt]]s (day)
500 watts (night) | class = B | facility_id = 35504 | coordinates = {{Coord|44|59|20|N|93|21|6|W|region:US-MN_type:landmark|display=inline,title}} | callsign_meaning = Former callsign of sister station [[KDIZ (AM)|KDIZ]] ('''K''' '''Y'''our '''C'''hristian '''R'''adio) | former_callsigns = KEYD (1948-1956)
KEVE (1956-1964)
KQRS (1964-1982)
KGLD (1982-1984)
KQRS (1984-1996)
KDIZ (1996-2015) | affiliations = Wall Street Business Network | owner = [[Salem Media Group]] | licensee = Salem Communications Holding Corporation | sister_stations = [[KDIZ (AM)|KDIZ]], [[KKMS (AM)|KKMS]], [[WWTC]] | webcast = [http://saleminteractivemedia.com/ListenLive/Player/KYCRAM Listen Live] | website = [http://www.twincitiesbusinessradio.com twincitiesbusinessradio.com] }} '''KYCR''' (1440 [[AM broadcasting|AM]]) is a [[radio station]] serving the [[Minneapolis-St. Paul]] metropolitan area. It is owned by [[Salem Media Group]], and is carrying a business radio format. KYCR's studios are located in [[Eagan, Minnesota|Eagan]], while its transmitter is located in Golden Valley. ==History== [[File:Radio Disney1440 2010.png|left|150px|thumb|''Radio Disney 1440'' logo used from 2010 to 2013.]] The original call letters were '''KEYD''' and the station played [[country music]] for many years. The station was launched in May 1948 by former management and advertisers of [[KFAN (AM)|WDGY]], who had become disenchanted with the owners of that station over the discontinuance of religious programming. Family Broadcasting basically started the station as a new home for the spurned WDGY programming. KEYD got a sister TV station in 1955, KEYD-TV 9 (now [[KMSP-TV]]), and the two stations were co-owned by Family Broadcasting until mid-[[1956 in radio|1956]]. The original KEYD radio studios were located in downtown [[Minneapolis]] on 9th Street off of Hennepin Avenue practically next to the Orpheum Theater (see photo link below). According to the 1955 Broadcasting Yearbook, both the AM and TV stations were co-located in the Foshay Tower by the end of 1955. The [[call sign]] was changed to '''KEVE''' in June 1956{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=gAoEAAAAMBAJ|title=Billboard|last=Inc|first=Nielsen Business Media|date=1956-06-23|publisher=Nielsen Business Media, Inc.|language=en}} and the studios moved to the station's transmitter and antenna site at 917 Lilac Drive in Golden Valley. During that time, the station played [[country music]]. [[KQRS-FM|KEVE-FM]] (92.5 FM) signed on September 1, 1962, and by October 1963, it was given the call letters '''KADM''' to match its AM sister as the pair became known as "Adam and Eve in the Valley"; the city of license for the two stations is the suburb of Golden Valley. A gradual shift from country music to a mix of [[classical music]], [[show tunes]] and [[adult standards]] began in 1960 and was completed on both stations by March 1963.{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=fQsEAAAAMBAJ|title=Billboard|last=Inc|first=Nielsen Business Media|date=1963-03-30|publisher=Nielsen Business Media, Inc.|language=en}} On December 1, 1964, the call letters for both stations became '''[[KQRS-FM|KQRS]]''' for "Quality Radio Stations". In 1967, the stations began experimenting with [[freeform (radio format)|freeform rock]] music from midnight to 5 AM every night via the "Night Watch" program, playing [[rhythm and blues|R&B]], [[jazz]] and [[psychedelic rock]]. The foray proved successful and by the end of 1968 it became the full-time format. The two KQs were a simulcast until 1982, when the AM briefly switched to an [[oldies]] format as '''KGLD''' before returning to the simulcast. The KGLD calls became effective November 22, 1982, with the KQRS calls returning on March 28, 1984. In 1985, [[ABC Radio Network]], then a division of the original [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC, Inc.]] bought the station and its main FM counterpart with it from previous owner Hudson Communications Corporation, a radio broadcasting company owned by [[Washington D.C.]] lawyer Joe McKenna, which owned the station from 1956 to 1985. Along with its main FM sister, it was ABC's first foray into the Minnesota broadcast market. At first, ABC programmed the station with a [[classic rock]] format, albeit essentially being an AM simulcast of its FM sister at the time from 1985 until 1996. The station again broke away from the simulcast in late 1996, this time permanently, when it became one of the four initial affiliates of the new Radio Disney with a children's format that competed with [[WWTC]], then the flagship station of "[[Radio Aahs]]," which had its own children's format. The station's call letters changed to '''KDIZ''' on November 15, 1996. With the advent of [[HD Radio]], KDIZ began broadcasting with the technology, as did most other Radio Disney affiliates. Disney had previously been collaborating with [[Children's Broadcasting Corporation|Radio Aahs]], which was based in Minneapolis and had launched its children's format in 1990. Radio Aahs had grown to approximately 30 affiliate stations around the country. Disney withdrew from the Aahs contract and began competing against Aahs with Radio Disney. Children's Broadcasting Corp. sued Disney and was awarded $9.5 million in 2002. Disney appealed, and after the court upheld the judgement, it was paid in 2005; with accumulated interest, the total was $12.4 million. On November 12, 2005, the station made world news when a riot erupted at its "Jingle Jam Concert" featuring [[B5 (band)|B5]], forcing the venue, Brookdale Mall, to be closed. Members of the group were stripped of shirts, shoes and earrings. On August 13, 2014, Disney put KDIZ and twenty-two other [[Radio Disney]] stations up for sale, in order to focus more on digital distribution of the Radio Disney network.{{cite news|last1=Lafayette|first1=Jon|title=Exclusive: Radio Disney Moving Off Air to Digital|url=http://broadcastingcable.com/news/currency/exclusive-radio-disney-moving-air-digital/133166|accessdate=August 13, 2014|date=August 13, 2014}}{{cite web|title=Radio Disney to Sell the Majority of Its Stations|url=http://www.billboard.com/biz/articles/6214509/radio-disney-to-sell-the-majority-of-its-stations|website=Billboard|accessdate=13 August 2014|ref=13 August 2014}} It held the distinction of being not only the longest-tenured Radio Disney station in its history, but also one of ABC's longest-tenured non-mainstream radio stations in its history. It was also the last-remaining Disney/ABC broadcast property in Minnesota, having had sold the others in 2007, with ABC Radio going to [[Citadel Broadcasting]] ([[KXXR]], acquired in 1993, [[Love 105]], acquired in 1997, and [[KQRS-FM]], acquired in 1985). On September 15, 2015, it was announced that [[Salem Media Group]] acquired the last five Radio Disney owned-and-operated stations for sale (including KDIZ) for $2.225 million.{{Cite web|url=https://radioinsight.com/blog/headlines/94556/salem-acquires-radio-disneys-final-five/|title=Salem Acquires Radio Disney’s Final Five|date=2015-09-15|website=RadioInsight|language=en-US|access-date=2016-05-08}} KDIZ was acquired through Common Ground Broadcasting, Inc., for $375.000.{{cite web|title=Application for Consent to Assignment of Broadcast Station Construction Permit or License|url=http://licensing.fcc.gov/cgi-bin/ws.exe/prod/cdbs/forms/prod/prefill_and_display.pl?Application_id=1686442&Service=AM&Form_id=314&Facility_id=35504|work=CDBS Public Access|publisher=[[Federal Communications Commission]]}} Salem put a business format on the station in December 2015 (taken from 1570 AM),{{Cite web|url=https://radioinsight.com/blog/headlines/95554/salem-debuts-new-stations-in-denver-minneapolis/|title=Salem Debuts New Stations In Denver & Minneapolis|date=2015-12-17|website=RadioInsight|language=en-US|access-date=2016-05-08}} after a brief period of silence. The format features [[Dave Ramsey]] and other business-talk oriented shows.{{cite web|title=St. Cloud AM DX logs|url=http://www.ubstudios.com/stcloudam.html|work=Ubstudios.com|accessdate=December 12, 2015}} The sale of KDIZ was completed on December 15, 2015.{{Cite web|url=http://licensing.fcc.gov/cgi-bin/ws.exe/prod/cdbs/forms/prod/prefill_and_display.pl?Application_id=1712715&Service=AM&Form_id=905&Facility_id=35504|title=Application View ... Redirecting|last=Staff|first=FCC Internet Services|website=licensing.fcc.gov|access-date=2016-05-08}} The station changed its callsign to KYCR on December 24th.[https://licensing.fcc.gov/cgi-bin/ws.exe/prod/cdbs/pubacc/prod/call_hist.pl?Facility_id=35504&Callsign=KYCR Call Sign History - Federal Communications Commission] With the sale to Salem, the company shut off the station's HD Radio transmission. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{AM station data|KYCR}} *[http://collections.mnhs.org/visualresources/image.cfm?imageid=167750&Page=1&Keywords=keyd&SearchType=Basic KEYD-AM exterior photo, 1953, from The Minnesota Historical Society] *[http://www.twincitiesradioairchecks.com/ TwinCitiesRadioAirchecks.com Recordings of KDIZ predecessor, KQRS, and other Twin Cities radio stations] *[http://www.radiotapes.com/KQRS/KEYD-AM_1949.pdf KEYD 1949 promotional station profile] *[http://radiotapes.com/documents/TheHistoryofWDGY-AM.pdf University of Minnesota 1970 thesis on the history of WDGY at radiotapes.com, page 67] *[http://www.pavekmuseum.org/HOF_Gallery/images/tvchrontc.htm Historical reference to KEYD-AM and TV ''Pavek Museum Of Broadcasting''] *[http://www.davidgleason.com/Broadcasting_Yearbook_Summary_Page.htm Broadcasting Yearbooks 1949-1965] *[http://svartifoss2.fcc.gov/cgi-bin/ws.exe/prod/cdbs/pubacc/prod/call_hist.pl?Facility_id=35504&Callsign=KDIZ Station's call sign changes at FCC database] *[http://twincities.bizjournals.com/twincities/stories/2004/04/26/daily7 Radio Aahs receives $12 million payment from ABC, Disney] {{Minneapolis-St. Paul Radio}} {{Salem Media Group}} {{News/Talk Radio Stations in Minnesota}} [[Category:News and talk radio stations in the United States]] [[Category:Radio stations in Minnesota]] [[Category:Radio stations established in 1948]] [[Category:1948 establishments in Minnesota]] [[Category:Salem media properties]] [[Category:Business talk radio stations]] [[Category:Business media in the United States]]

[[File:Keihanna Plaza.jpg|thumb|Keihanna Plaza in Seika]] [[File:The Learned Memorial Library at Doshisha University, Kyotanabe, Japan.JPG|thumb|Doshisha University in Kyotanabe]] {{nihongo|'''Kansai Science City'''|関西文化学術研究都市|Kansai Bunka-gakujutsu-kenkyū-toshi}} is an unincorporated city located in the {{nihongo|''Keihanna Hills''|京阪奈丘陵|Keihanna kyūryō}}, a border region between [[Kyoto Prefecture|Kyoto]], [[Osaka Prefecture|Osaka]], and [[Nara Prefecture|Nara]] Prefectures in [[Kansai region]], [[Japan]]. It is about 25 km south from the city of [[Kyoto]], 30 km east from the city of [[Osaka]]. The name is commonly shortened to {{nihongo|'''Keihanna Science City'''|けいはんな学研都市|Keihanna Gakken-toshi}} or {{nihongo|''Gakken-toshi''|学研都市}}. The city was constructed to help the advancement of creative arts, sciences, and research, as well as to spur the creation of new industries and cultures.
== Location == Kansai Science City is located in portions of the following eight {{nihongo|cities|市|shi}} and {{nihongo|towns|町|chō}}, in three [[Prefectures of Japan|prefectures]]:
[[Osaka Prefecture]] *{{nihongo|[[Hirakata, Osaka|Hirakata]]|枚方市|Hirakata-shi}} *{{nihongo|[[Katano]]|交野市|Katano-shi}} *{{nihongo|[[Shijōnawate]]|四條畷市|Shijōnawate-shi}}
[[Kyoto Prefecture]] *{{nihongo|[[Kyōtanabe, Kyoto|Kyōtanabe]]|京田辺市|Kyōtanabe-shi}} *{{nihongo|[[Kizugawa, Kyoto|Kizugawa]]|木津川市|Kizugawa-shi}} *{{nihongo|[[Sōraku District, Kyoto|Sōraku District]]|相楽郡|Sōraku-gun}} *{{nihongo|[[Seika, Kyoto|Seika]]|精華町|Seika-chō}}
[[Nara Prefecture]] *{{nihongo|[[Ikoma, Nara|Ikoma]]|生駒市|Ikoma-shi}} *{{nihongo|[[Nara, Nara|Nara]]|奈良市|Nara-shi}}
Out of these, [[Seika, Kyoto|Seika]] in Kyoto Prefecture is completely inside the Kansai Science City.
The overall area of the Kansai Science City is 150 km², with an estimated population of 410,000. There are 12 "Culture and Scientific Research Districts" within the Kansai Science City, encompassing 36 km², with an estimated population of 210,000.
== Main research institutes and universities == ===Universities=== *[[Kansai Gaidai University]] *[[Osaka Electro-Communication University]] *[[Doshisha University]] *[[Doshisha Women's College of Liberal Arts]] *[[Osaka University]], Institute of [[Free electron laser]] (iFEL)[http://www.fel.eng.osaka-u.ac.jp/link.html] *[[Nara Institute of Science and Technology]]
===Research institutes=== *[[National Institute of Information and Communications Technology]] *[http://www.atr.jp/index_e.html Advanced Telecommunications Research Institute International] *[[Shimadzu Corp.]] (Keihanna Research Laboratory ) *[[Kyocera]] ([[Basic Research]] Laboratory: [[optical]] and [[electronic devices]], [[solar cells]],advanced thin-film technologies) *[[Japan Atomic Energy Agency]], Kansai [[Photon]] Science Institute [http://wwwapr.kansai.jaea.go.jp/jaea/e/outline/detail.html] (Advanced Photon Research Center, [[Neutron]] Biology Research Center) *[[NEC]] *[[Matsushita Electric Industrial Co.]] (Panasonic) *[[OMRON]] (Keihanna Technology Innovation Center) *[[Santen Pharmaceutical]] *[[Rohto Pharmaceutical Co.]] *Kansai Electronic Industry Development Center (supported by the [[Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry]][http://www.kec.jp/english/narte/narte.html]) *[[Ion]] Engineering Research Institute *Research Institute of Innovative Technology for the Earth (supported by the Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry [http://www.rite.or.jp/English/E-home-frame.html] )
===Other=== *[[Kansai-kan of the National Diet Library]] *[[Nara Research Institute for Cultural Properties]] *[[Heijō Palace]]
== Transportation == *[[West Japan Railway Company]] (JR West), [[Katamachi Line|Gakkentoshi Line]] *[[Kintetsu Railway|Kintetsu]] [[Kyoto Line (Kintetsu)|Kyoto Line]] *[[Keihanna Line]] *About 100 minutes by bus from [[Kansai International Airport]]. *[[Second Keihan Highway]] *Keinawa Expressway
In 2016, a government committee planning the final Kyoto-Osaka segment of the [[Hokuriku Shinkansen]] proposed routing the new high-speed line through the Kansai Science City.<ref>{{cite news|title=北陸新幹線、「けいはんな」通る第３案 京都と大阪間、与党委|url=http://www.nikkei.com/article/DGXLZO99522830R10C16A4LDA000/?n_cid=kobetsu|accessdate=13 April 2016|work=The Nikkei|date=12 April 2016}}</ref>
==See also == *[[Hanshin Industrial Region]]
