{{EngvarB|date=August 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=August 2014}}
{{Infobox person | name = | image = Steve Bolton photographed in 2017.jpg | caption = Steve Bolton photographed in 2017 | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1967|12|18|df=yes}} }}
'''Steve Bolton''' (born 18 December 1967) is a leading British entrepreneur, [[property]] [[investor]], author<ref name=":0">{{Cite book|url=https://www.worldcat.org/oclc/936100333|title=How to earn 50,000 pounds to 150,000 pounds a year from property investing.|last=Bolton|first=Steve|date=2012|publisher=Platinum Partners Press|year=|isbn=9780956364616|location=|pages=|oclc=936100333|quote=|via=}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://www.performingartistes.co.uk/artistes/851/steve-bolton.htm|title=Performing Artistes|last=|first=|date=|website=www.performingartistes.co.uk|publisher=F4 Group Ltd.|access-date=21 January 2017}}</ref><ref name=":2">{{Cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Steve-Bolton/e/B003787UFK|title=Steve Bolton: Books, Biography, Blog, Audiobooks, Kindle|last=|first=|date=|website=www.amazon.com|publisher=Amazon|access-date=21 January 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.triumphantevents.co.uk/events?access=unleash-influence-nov|title=Unleash Your Power of Influence - November|last=|first=|date=|website=www.triumphantevents.co.uk|publisher=Triumphant Events|language=en|access-date=23 April 2013}}</ref> and philanthropist. He is the Founder and Executive Chairman of the franchised businesses Platinum Property Partners and Platinum Business Partners.
Bolton’s personal vision is to help as many people as possible to achieve greater wealth, health and happiness and his mission and that of the Platinum companies is to help others be more, do more, have more and give more in life.
==Early life== The son of a Lancashire miner turned professional footballer (for [[Bournemouth]], [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] and [[Durban City F.C.|Durban City]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bournemouth.vitalfootball.co.uk/article.asp?a=249924 |title=The AFCB Vital Hall of Fame - 1945 - 1960 |website=www.bournemouth.vitalfootball.co.uk |accessdate=7 August 2011}}</ref>) and a French mother (a hairdresser), Bolton was born in [[Bournemouth]], lived in South Africa between the ages of two and five, and then returned to [[Bournemouth]] where he attended Winton Junior and Secondary schools.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":2" /><ref name=":3">{{Cite news|url=http://platinumpropertypartners.co.uk/why-platinum/meet-the-team/|title=Successful investors in property helping you to succeed|last=|first=|date=|work=|newspaper=Platinum Property Partners|language=en-US|access-date=21 January 2017|via=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.linkedin.com/in/steveboltonppp|title=Steve Bolton {{!}} LinkedIn|last=|first=|date=|website=www.linkedin.com|publisher=LinkedIn Corporation|language=en|access-date=23 April 2013}}</ref>
At an early age, with encouragement from his father, Bolton was interested in wealth creation, following [[stocks]] and [[shares]] from the age of eight and writing basic computer programmes with the goal of predicting the outcome of [[Horse racing|horse races]] at the age of 13.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":2" /> Bolton was also exposed to property investment at an early age when his parents purchased a block of 16 flats and converted them into holiday apartments when he was 11 years of age. The family lived in one of the flats and Bolton spent his summer holidays helping his family run the business and working alongside his father as a carpenter's mate.
Bolton attended Winton Boys Secondary school and left aged 16 with no qualifications. After working a variety of jobs including as a kitchen porter and shelf stacker at a local supermarket, Bolton decided to follow his love of sports and the outdoors and accepted an [[apprenticeship]] working in [[outdoor pursuits]].<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" /><ref name=":2" /><ref name=":3" />
Bolton worked as an outdoor pursuits instructor at the [http://allnatt.co.uk/ Joseph Allnatt] chain of activity centres on the south coast of England where he was quickly promoted to hold the position of head of activities, with 25 staff reporting to him at the age of 19. He was then headhunted in 1992 to help set up and establish Brenscombe Outdoor Pursuits<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.brenscombeoutdoor.co.uk/|title=Brenscombe Outdoor Centre|last=|first=|date=|website=www.brenscombeoutdoor.co.uk|publisher=|language=en|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref> as the most senior member of staff.
==Early career== Bolton decided in 1994 that he wanted to ‘be his own boss’ and he joined the recently established Ropes Course Developments (RCD)<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.rcd.co.uk/index.html|title=Ropes Course Developments - Founder of the European Ropes Course Industry|website=www.rcd.co.uk|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref> as a shareholder and Director.
The company went on to build high and low adventure ropes courses for [[Center Parcs]],<ref name=":1" /> [[First Choice Holidays]], the [[Royal Air Force]] and many others across Europe and in South Africa.<ref name=":2" /><ref name=":3" /><ref name=":4">{{Cite web|url=http://www.zoominfo.com/p/Steve-Bolton/30825200|title=Steve Bolton Peace One Day|last=Steve|first=Bolton|date=2013|website=|publisher=Zoom Information|language=en|access-date=23 April 2013}}</ref><ref name=":5">{{Cite news|url=http://www.theedge-uk.com/steve_bolton.htm|title=Steve Bolton - Property Expert & Business - Keynote Speaker|last=|first=|date=|work=|language=en|access-date=23 April 2013|via=The Edge-UK}}</ref>
He was a co-founder of a national association and helped to push through safety standards for both the construction and training of ropes courses. These standards were ratified industry-wide and paved the way for the mainstream adoption of high and low ropes courses, which are now commonplace in the UK.
As the business grew, Bolton established Vision Development Training, which operated out of Wokefield Park, now the De Vere Wokefield Estate in Reading. The company provided experiential outdoor personal, management and organisational development programmes for blue chip clients like British Airways, Microsoft and KPMG,<ref name=":2" /><ref name=":3" /><ref name=":4" /> as well as other high-profile organisations including the British Lions.
In the early 2000’s, Bolton and his partners set up the outdoor activity facilities and businesses, Aerial Extreme<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.aerialextreme.co.uk/|title=Aerial Extreme|last=|first=|date=|website=www.aerialextreme.co.uk|publisher=|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref> and Head 4 Heights.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.head4heights.net/|title=Head 4 Heights|last=|first=|date=|website=www.head4heights.net|publisher=|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref>
Following what he describes in his book<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B009PPO7MS/ref=dp-kindle-redirect?_encoding=UTF8&btkr=1|title=Successful Property Investing: How to Earn £50,000 to £150,000 in Two to Five Years|last=Bolton|first=Steve|date=11 October 2012|publisher=Platinum Partners Press|language=English}}</ref> as the ‘best worst experience’ of his life when the [[Foot and mouth#United Kingdom 2001|2001 outbreak of foot and mouth disease in Britain]] and the economic fallout that followed the [[September 11 attacks|9/11 attacks]], meant that the market demand dried up and pushed Ropes Course Developments into liquidation, Bolton had to sell his family home to avoid bankruptcy in early 2002.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" /><ref name=":2" />
Bolton decided to exit all business interests related to ropes courses in early 2002.
Still an entrepreneur at heart, Bolton set about starting his first ‘virtual’ business and Mobile Team Challenge Europe (MTC) was formed. The company became the European distributor for Mobile Team Challenge in America and it imported training equipment from the USA and sold it to clients in the UK and Europe. MTC was a business where Bolton employed no staff, needed no office premises, never handled the products and was able to work on a very part-time basis by outsourcing most of the work. The business generated a consistent six figure annual net profit for several years in succession before being sold to an investor.
==Property investing== Alongside running MTC, Bolton invested significant time and money to learn how to build a robust income stream for himself and his family through investing in property. Two years of very intensive research, learning and development between 2002 and 2004 took him all over the world and he was mentored and taught by the best investors that he could find.
Between 2004 and 2007, Bolton purchased £6 million of residential property and converted most of them into high quality Houses in Multiple Occupancy (HMOs), producing average annual returns of 15% and providing affordable shared homes to 80 tenants.
Having developed his own portfolio, he acted on his accountant's suggestion to develop a franchise, which would enable others to build their own profitable portfolios following his model.<ref name=":3" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://elitebusinessmagazine.co.uk/franchise/item/breaching-the-canopy|title=Breaching the canopy - Elite Franchise Magazine|last=Russel|first=Josh|date=|website=Elite Business Magazine|publisher=CE Media|language=en-gb|access-date=28 February 2013}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.director.co.uk/magazine/2009/8%20September/partners_63_01.html|title=Director|last=|first=|date=2013|website=Nick Carlisle, Richard Davies and Steve Bolton {{!}} Platinum Property Partners|publisher=Director Publications|language=en-GB|access-date=23 April 2013}}</ref>
==Platinum Property Partners== Bolton founded and launched Platinum Property Partners on 1 July 2007, with the goal of enabling its Franchise Partners to quickly, safely and successfully build profitable residential property portfolios in the UK, and to create more new and affordable rental homes for key workers and working professionals.<ref name=":3" /><ref name=":5" /><ref name="PR Log">{{cite web|last=PR Log|title=Property guru Steve Bolton to speak at the 2011 franchise show in London|url=http://www.prlog.org/11255090-property-guru-steve-bolton-to-speak-at-the-2011-franchise-show-in-london.html|work=PR Log press release distribution|publisher=PR Log|accessdate=24 April 2013}}</ref><ref name="Executives on the Web">{{cite web|last=Executives on the Web|title=Business Owner / Franchise Partner Franchise in UK|url=http://www.executivesontheweb.com/franchise/request.cfm?opportunity_id=326839|work=Executives on the Web|publisher= ExecutivesOnTheWeb.com 2000–2013|accessdate=24 April 2013}}</ref><ref name="Making Money Magazine">{{cite web|title=Platinum Property Partners, Franchisor, Franchising Opportunities – Making Money Magazine|url=http://www.makingmoney.co.uk/franchise-opportunity/franchisor/platinum-property-partners/business-&-professional-services/|work=Making Money Magazine|publisher=Aceville Publications Ltd|accessdate=24 April 2013}}</ref><ref name="Business Franchise">{{cite web|title=Business Franchise: New Lease of Life – New Lease of Life|url=https://www.businessfranchise.com/article-page/1569|work=Business Franchise|publisher=Business Franchise Magazine|accessdate=24 April 2013}}</ref><ref name="Article Dashboard">{{cite web|last=Macall|first=Fiona|title=Interview with Steve Bolton, Multi-millionaire specialising in below market value properties|url=http://www.articledashboard.com/Article/Interview-with-Steve-Bolton-Multi-Millionaire-Specialising-in-Below-Market-Value-Properties/2141170|work=Article Dashboard|publisher=2005 -2011 Article Dashboard|accessdate=24 April 2013}}</ref><ref name="Business Franchises">{{cite web|title=Modern Day Property Guru Steve Bolton to speak at the Franchise Show in February 2011|url=http://www.sealrez.com/2012/01/Modern-Day-Property-Guru-Steve-Bolton-to-Speak-at-The-Franchise-Show-in-February-2011/|work=Business Franchises|publisher=Business Franchises|accessdate=24 April 2013}}</ref><ref name="Franchise Info">{{cite web|title=Franchise Info|url=https://www.franchiseinfo.co.uk/franchise-pages/premier/platinumpropertypartners|work=Franchise Info|publisher=Franchise Info|accessdate=24 April 2013}}</ref><ref name="Start Up TV">{{cite web|title=Steve Bolton, Platinum Property Partners – Platinum Property Partners|url=http://www.startuptv.co.uk/directory/franchise/ppp/ppp-seminar.html|work=Start Up TV|publisher=The Entrepreneurs Academy|accessdate=24 April 2013}}</ref><ref name=Accountex>{{cite web|title=Steve Bolton – The National Accountancy Exhibition and Conference|url=http://www.accountex.co.uk/speakers/steve-bolton/|work=Accountex|publisher=Prysm BSU Limited|accessdate=24 April 2013}}</ref><ref name="Steve Bolton - Entrepreneur and successful businessman">{{cite web|last=Performing Artistes|title=Steve Bolton – Entrepreneur and successful businessman|url=http://www.performingartistes.co.uk/artistes/851/steve-bolton.html|work=Performing Artistes|publisher=F4 Group Ltd|accessdate=28 February 2013}}</ref>
Platinum Property Partners (known as PPP) has since become the fastest<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.franchiseexpo.co.uk/resources/interview-with-a-ceo/sept/interview-with-ceo-of-platinum-property-partnersppp--steve-bolton|title=Interview with CEO of Platinum Property Partners(PPP)- Steve Bolton|website=www.franchiseexpo.co.uk|language=en|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref> growing premium franchise in UK history.
PPP is a successful and socially responsible franchise business that has helped over 250 Franchise Partners (as of January 2017) to source, own, develop and manage more than 800 buy to let properties) with a combined value of £250 million and an annual rent roll in excess of £36 million per annum. This portfolio provides high quality and affordable homes for over 5,000 tenants in over 100 towns, cities and London boroughs in England, Wales, Scotland and Australia.
Tenants who live in PPP properties spend a lower percentage of their income on rent, enabling them to save more of their income each month, thereby accelerating their path onto the property ladder for those that have that goal in mind.
PPP is award-winning and a full member of British Franchise Association<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.thebfa.org/members/platinum-property-partners|title=Platinum Property Partners - British Franchise Association|last=|first=|date=|website=|publisher=|access-date=}}</ref>
Platinum’s Franchise Partners are currently buying and developing property at a rate of around £10 million every three months, creating around 1,000 new rooms for young professionals in shared homes annually.
==Platinum Business Partners== In 2016 Bolton and his partners expanded the tried, tested and proven Platinum franchising brand and system diversified into ecommerce and became the co-Founder of Platinum Business Partners<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.platinumbusinesspartners.co.uk/|title=Platinum Business Partners|last=|first=|date=|website=Platinum Business Partners|publisher=|language=en-US|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref> (known as PBP), which helps its clients set up their own successful ecommerce businesses. The organisation currently has over 80 Franchise Partners selling more than 300 product lines to 100,000 individual online customers globally.
The business supports it Franchise Partners in sourcing and buying products wholesale from places like China and the USA and then marketing and selling them through retail ecommerce platforms like Amazon, Shopify and others. It also helps existing retail business owners pivot and turn their ‘bricks and mortar’ business, into a ‘bricks and clicks’ business.
Always keen to lead by example, Bolton also formed an ecommerce business in 2016 with two partners and this provides a growing range of dog supplements under the Buddy & Lola brand.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.amazon.com/Buddy-Lola/b/ref=bl_dp_s_web_14059711011?ie=UTF8&node=14059711011&field-lbr_brands_browse-bin=Buddy+&+Lola|title=Amazon.com: Buddy & Lola|website=www.amazon.com|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref>
==Other business interests== Bolton also has interests in residential and commercial property projects. He is a co-founder of Platinum Asset Management, which owns a range of commercial property<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.platinumbusinesscentre.co.uk/|title=Platinum Business Centre - Offices to rent in Bournemouth, office space in Bournemouth, Serviced offices|website=www.platinumbusinesscentre.co.uk|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref> providing inspiring workspaces for small businesses, some retail shops and three hotels in a prime development location in the town centre of Bournemouth. He also has interests in multiple ecommerce businesses.
==Philanthropy== [[File:The new buildings at the King's Kid orphanage.jpg|thumb|right|The new buildings at the King's Kid orphanage]] Bolton is a Life Patron of the not-for-profit organisation [[Peace One Day]].<ref name=":3" /><ref name=":4" /> For more than a decade he worked with the organisation and helped to raise millions of pounds in funding.
The charity is dedicated to achieving [[International Day of Peace|global ceasefire and non-violence for one day every year on 21 September]] and is ratified by the United Nations.<ref name=":0" /> 13 million<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.peaceoneday.org/about/impact|title=Impact|newspaper=Peace One Day|language=en|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref> people are estimated to be acting more peacefully as a result of Peace Day (source McKinsey's).
The organisation has also seen 4.5 million children being vaccinated against polio in previously unreachable areas after Peace One Day ambassador Jude Law travelled to Afghanistan to spearhead a campaign.
During his involvement with Peace One Day from 2007 to 2015, Bolton created and led the Patrons programme where he helped to ensure that the organisation was on a sound financial footing. He also led a project to acquire, fund, purchase and convert offices premises in Richmond, Surrey, which continue to be the headquarters for Peace One Day.
Bolton and his Platinum businesses have also provided funding to the King’s Kid Orphanage<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.kingskidhome.com/our-partners|title=King's Kid Home|website=King's Kid Home|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref> in Mitiana, Uganda since 2007. This funding and investment has resulted in the purchase and construction of housing, classrooms, a deep water well, farming land as well as food, teachers’ salaries, secure accommodation for the orphanage director, medical procedures and further education funding for orphanage. The orphanage is home to 300 children and is self-sustaining.
==Books and speaking== Bolton’s book, Successful Property Investing, was an Amazon bestseller and has been updated three times since first publication in 2008.<ref name=":0" /><ref name=":3" /><ref name=":4" /><ref name="Accountex" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.lovereading.co.uk/author/Steve-Bolton,-Nick-Carlile/gd/Steve-Bolton-Nick-Carlile.html|title=Steve-Bolton,-Nick-Carlile Books, Ebooks and Recommendations. Buy Steve-Bolton,-Nick-Carlile Books at Lovereading.co.uk|last=|first=|date=|website=lovereading.co.uk.|publisher=Love Reading|access-date=24 April 2013}}</ref>
He is also a [[keynote]] speaker<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.triumphantevents.co.uk/events?access=pod-gettingabove|title=Triumphant Events POD Talks {{!}} Getting above the Noise|last=|first=|date=|website=www.triumphantevents.co.uk|publisher=|language=en|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref> having spoken on stages alongside Richard Reed (Innocent), Simon Woodroffe (YO!), James Caan (Dragons Den), Kriss Akabussi (World Champion athlete), Davina McCall, Ben Fogle, Michael Gerber (Emyth) and many others.
His primary keynote talk is ‘Standing on the Shoulders of Giants’ which promotes the core concept Bolton believes in passionately - ‘everyone should have a mentor’.
Bolton also speaks regularly and for free at local schools and universities on the subject of wealth, health and happiness, as well as entrepreneurship, principles of success and personal development. He is passionate about inspiring the next generation of entrepreneurs.
==Axe the tenant tax== In 2016 Bolton co-founded and continues to lead a grassroots not-for-profit campaign called Axe the Tenant Tax.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.tenanttax.co.uk|title=Axe the Tenant Tax|newspaper=Tenant Tax|language=en-US|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref>
In a UK first, Bolton united the private rented sector by forming a Coalition of all of the major organisations who are opposed to new government legislation that restricts landlords’ ability to deduct mortgage finance costs as a business expense. Coalition stakeholders represent more than 100,000 landlords who provide housing to more than 1 million tenants in the UK.
Bolton and fellow landlord Chris Cooper were co-claimants in a Judicial Review against the UK government in relation to the legality of Section 24 of the Finance (No. 2) Act 2015. Their legal team was led by Cherie Blair CBE QC and their legal challenge campaign broke two legal crowdfunding records in 2016 by raising over £200,000 within the fastest recorded timeframe.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.crowdjustice.org/case/clause24/|title=Alice in Wonderland Tax Grab|newspaper=CrowdJustice|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.crowdjustice.org/case/tenanttax/|title=Landlords Fight Back #TenantTax|newspaper=CrowdJustice|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref>
The campaign has been covered in hundreds of media articles, and Bolton has met the housing Minister, the Chancellor of the Exchequer and MPs. Bolton believes the tax is a disaster for the UK housing market and is championing the cause for the small landlords and tenants who will suffer badly if this tax comes into force.
Their Judicial Review was thwarted at the High Court on 6 October 2016.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/money/2016/oct/06/landlords-lose-legal-challenge-buy-to-let-tax-changes-cherie-booth|title=Landlords lose legal challenge over buy-to-let tax changes|last=Jones|first=Rupert|date=2016-10-06|last2=Collinson|first2=Patrick|newspaper=The Guardian|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref> Bolton and Cooper have since focussed their campaign efforts on lobbying the UK government and working with MPs and Tenant Tax coalition members to get the government to do a U-turn.
==Mentoring== For six years Bolton was a mentor for the Key Person of Influence programme,<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.dent.global/team/|title=Our Team - Dent Global|newspaper=Dent Global|language=en-US|access-date=20 January 2017}}</ref> mentoring several thousand entrepreneurs and business owners during that time in a group setting.
Bolton provides high impact one to one mentoring to multi-millionaires, celebrities and global change-makers. His mentoring efforts in recent years have focussed around ‘mentoring the mentors’ and all of the Platinum franchise businesses have at their core, a one to one mentoring approach that the Platinum team deliver.
==Media appearances== Bolton and his businesses have been featured on a number of TV programmes and in media outlets including BBC,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b01ml5f7 |title=Home Under the Hammer, Series 16, Episode 33 |work=BBC One|accessdate=30 August 2015}}</ref> Channel Four,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.channel4.com/programmes/dispatches/on-demand/59622-001 |title=Dispatches - The British Property Boom|work=Channel 4 |accessdate=20 January 2017}}</ref> Sky News, Financial Times, Sunday Times, The Telegraph,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/investing/buy-to-let/cherie-booth-challenge-to-buy-to-let-tax-not-over-yet-despite-ju/ |title=Cherie Booth: Challenge to buy-to-let tax 'not over yet' despite judicial review failure |work=The Telegraph |accessdate=7 October 2016|first=Olivia|last=Rudgard }}</ref> Guardian,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/oct/04/cherie-blair-represent-landlords-changes-tax-regime |title=Cherie Booth to represent landlords fighting changes to tax regime |work=The Guardian |accessdate=4 October 2016|first=Matthew|last=Taylor }}</ref> Express, the Mail and many trade publications in the franchise, entrepreneur, property and business sectors.
He is often quoted in national media in relation to franchising, property, entrepreneurship and mentoring.
==Personal life== Steve Bolton lives in Bournemouth with his wife, four children and two dogs. He takes three months holiday every year with his family and has done since 2004. His personal interests include parenting, world-travel, boating, sport and spear fishing, free-diving, health and juicing, running and he is a keen AFC Bournemouth season ticket holder. Bolton is also an avid reader and learner with a personal library of books, audio programmes and DVD’s valued in excess of £100,000.
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}
==External links== * [http://www.peaceoneday.org Peace One Day] * [http://www.platinumpropertypartners.net Platinum Property Partners] * [https://www.platinumbusinesspartners.co.uk/ Platinum Business Partners]

{{Infobox book | name = The 50th Law | translator = | image = The50thLawBook.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Paperback edition | author = [[Robert Greene (American author)|Robert Greene]], [[50 Cent]] | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = United States | language = English | series = | subject = Strategy, self-help, philosophy | genre = Non-fiction | published = September 8, 2009 | publisher = Harper Studio | media_type = Print | pages = | isbn = | oclc = | preceded_by = [[The 33 Strategies of War]] | followed_by = [[Mastery (book)|Mastery]] }}
'''''The 50th Law''''' is a ''[[New York Times]]'' [[bestselling]] book on [[strategy]] and fearlessness written collaboratively by rapper [[50 Cent]] and author [[Robert Greene (American author)|Robert Greene]].<ref name=Vibe>{{cite web|title=50 Cent is New York Times Certified| url=http://www.vibe.com/article/50-cent-new-york-times-certified| publisher=Vibe |date=September 28, 2009}}</ref><ref name=NYTimeslist>{{cite news|title=Bestsellers|url=https://www.nytimes.com/best-sellers-books/2009-09-27/hardcover-advice/list.html|publisher=New York Times|date=September 27, 2009|first=Jennifer|last=Schuessler}}</ref><ref name=InsidetheList>{{cite news|last=Schuessler|first=Jennifer|title=Inside the List|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2009/09/27/books/review/InsideList-t.html?ref=books|publisher=New York Times|date=September 18, 2009}}</ref> The book is a semi-autobiographical account detailing 50 Cent's rise as both a young urban hustler and as an up-and-coming musician with lessons and anecdotes from historical figures such as [[Abraham Lincoln]], [[Sun Tzu]], [[Socrates]], [[Napoleon]], [[Malcolm X]], and [[James Baldwin]].<ref name=50thlawbook>{{cite book |title=The 50th Law |last1=Cent |first1=50 |last2=Greene |first2=Robert |year=2009 |publisher=HarperStudio |location=New York |isbn=978-1846680687 |pages=291 }}</ref><ref name=BusinessInsider>{{cite web|last=Groth|first=Aimee|title=10 Tips For Becoming Fearless Like 50 Cent |url=http://www.businessinsider.com/robert-greene-and-50-cents-50th-law-2012-5?op=1|publisher=Business Insider|date=May 10, 2012}}</ref><ref name=TheAustralian>{{cite news|last=Goodman|first=Matthew|title=Rapper's latest hit for business scene|url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/arts/rappers-latest-hit-for-business-scene/story-e6frg8n6-1225792219460|newspaper=The Australian|date=October 29, 2009}}</ref>
==Origins== ''The 50th Law'' grew out of the friendship and mutual admiration between 50 Cent and Robert Greene.<ref name=Forbes>{{cite news|last=Alder|first=Daniel|title=50 Cent's Partner In Prose|url=https://www.forbes.com/2009/07/08/fifty-cent-music-publishing-business-media-cash-kings-fifty.html|newspaper=Forbes|date=September 7, 2009}}</ref> Greene's book ''[[The 48 Laws of Power]]'', which has long been a staple in the [[hip hop]] world, came to the attention of 50 Cent, who asked his manager to arrange a meeting. Greene said that he was surprised by 50 Cent's persona and was impressed by his "Zen-like calmness" and eye for strategy.<ref name=the50thelaw>[http://powerseductionandwar.com/the-50th-law/ The 50th Law]. ''Power Seduction and War''. June 11, 2009.</ref> The two began to work on a book project that would combine their two worlds.<ref name=the50thelaw/><ref name=CNBC>{{cite web|title=50 Cent sits down with CNBC and talks about his new book "The 50th Law|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gCzb5zpV0PA|publisher=CNBC|date=October 1, 2009}}</ref>
According to Greene, 50 Cent is an example of what [[Machiavelli]] called a ''New Prince,'' a leader who emerges in a time of chaos or turmoil and rewrites the rules.<ref name=the50thelaw/> According to 50 Cent, Greene's books describe the laws and strategies used by hustlers on the street, even if they might not know the "technical terms" for what they were doing.<ref>[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tlp66y9ML3o 50 Cent Presents "The 50th Law" - Book with Robert Greene]. ''YouTube''. September 7, 2009.</ref>
==Synopsis== Each of the 10 chapters in the book explains a factor of fearlessness and begins by telling how 50 Cent learned this Fearless Philosophy in Southside [[Queens]].<ref name=HuffPost>{{cite news|last=Richards|first=Jason|title=Interview: Robert Greene on 50 Cent|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/jason-richards/interview-robert-greene-o_b_289888.html|newspaper=The Huffington Post|date=September 17, 2009}}</ref> ''The 50th Law'' illustrates the laws of the book by supplementing anecdotes from 50 Cent's life with historical examples from [[Malcolm X]], [[Miles Davis]], [[Sun Tzu]], [[François de La Rochefoucauld (writer)|François de La Rochefoucauld]], [[Niccolò Machiavelli|Machiavelli]], [[Richard Wright (author)|Richard Wright]], [[James Baldwin]], [[Thucydides]], [[Fyodor Dostoyevsky|Dostoyevsky]], [[Charlie Parker]], and the [[Montesquieu|Baron de Montesquieu]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.villagevoice.com/2009-10-13/music/on-50-cent-s-surreally-insightful-self-help-book-the-50th-law/ |title=The Eight Dookie Ropes of Wisdom in Fiddy Cent's Self-Help Book |newspaper=[[Village Voice]] |author=Rob Harvilla |date=October 13, 2009}}</ref><ref name=FastCompany>{{cite web|last=Johnson|first=Lynne|title=The 50 Cent Bible|url=http://www.fastcompany.com/1353390/50-cent-bible|publisher=Fast Company|date=September 10, 2009}}</ref><ref name=Billboard>{{cite web|last=Neilan|first=Catherine|title=50 Cent Business Book 'The 50th Law' Due This Fall|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/267962/50-cent-business-book-the-50th-law-due-this-fall|publisher=Billboard|date=July 23, 2009}}</ref>
==Reception== The book debuted at #5 on [[The New York Times Best Seller list|''The New York Times'' Bestseller list]] and was a ''[[USA Today]]'' bestseller.<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/best-sellers-books/2009-09-27/hardcover-advice/list.html Hardcover Advice & Misc. Bestsellers]. ''New York Times''. September 27, 2009.</ref><ref name=USATodaylist>{{cite news|title=USA TODAY Money best sellers|newspaper=USA Today|date=October 12, 2009}}</ref><ref name=USAToday>{{cite news|title=The 50th Law|url=http://books.usatoday.com/book/50-cent-robert-greene-the-50th-law/l28947|publisher=USA Today}}</ref> The book was met with positive reviews, with the ''[[New York Post]]'' calling ''The 50th Law'' "a modern day ''[[Art of War]]''," ''[[The Guardian]]'' referring to the book as "a manual on power similar to the works of Machiavelli and Sun Tzu," and ''[[Library Journal]]'' stating that ''The 50th Law'' is written for "anyone interested in how to succeed in business and the game of life."<ref name=Guardian>{{cite news|last=Burkeman|first=Oliver|title=When the gangsta rapper met the self-help guru|url=https://www.theguardian.com/global/2009/sep/05/50-cent-robert-greene-interview|newspaper=The Guardian|date=September 4, 2009|location=London}}</ref><ref name=NYPost>{{cite news|last=Getlen|first=Larry|title=Talking Cents|url=http://www.nypost.com/p/news/opinion/books/item_tguY4nvmF3fQokWV94jfnO|newspaper=New York Post|date=September 20, 2009}}</ref><ref name=LibraryJournal>{{cite web|last=Finnell|first=Joshua|title=The Blingdom of God: Books on the Religion of Hip-Hop|url=http://www.libraryjournal.com/article/CA6678919.html|publisher=Library Journal|date=August 20, 2009|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120915025144/http://www.libraryjournal.com/article/CA6678919.html|archivedate=September 15, 2012|df=}}</ref>
The book was also featured in ''[[The New York Times]]'', [[MSNBC]], ''[[Huffington Post]]'', ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]'', ''[[The New York Daily News]]'', ''[[Forbes]]'', [[Business Insider]], ''[[Fast Company (magazine)|Fast Company]]'', ''[[The Daily Telegraph|The Telegraph]]'', [[MTV]], ''[[Vibe (magazine)|Vibe]]'' and ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''.<ref name=Vibe/><ref name="NYTimeslist"/><ref name="BusinessInsider"/><ref name="Forbes"/><ref name="HuffPost"/><ref name="FastCompany"/><ref name=Billboard/><ref name="Guardian"/><ref name=MSNBC>{{cite web|title=50 Cent’s words of wisdom: Face reality|url=http://today.msnbc.msn.com/id/32691328/ns/today-today_books/#.UFbGCqRrOs9|publisher=MSNBC|date=September 8, 2009}}</ref><ref name=HuffPOstexcerpt>{{cite news|last=Greene|first=Robert|title=Keep Moving -- Flow|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/curtis-50-cent-jackson/keep-moving----flow_b_380221.html|newspaper=The Huffington Post|date=December 4, 2009}}</ref><ref name=TheSun>{{cite news|title=Get rich... and don’t die tryin’|url=http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/features/2702522/Rapper-50-cent-has-co-written-a-business-self-help-book.html|newspaper=The Sun|date=October 29, 2009|location=London}}</ref><ref name=NYDailyNews>{{cite news|last=Pearson|first=Erica|title=50 Cent pimps his new self-help book, 'The 50th Law' at Barnes & Noble|url=http://articles.nydailynews.com/2009-09-11/local/17933839_1_barnes-noble-noble-bookstore-postal-worker|newspaper=The New York Daily News|date=September 11, 2009}}</ref><ref name=MTVnews>{{cite web|last=Reid|first=Shaheem|title=50 Cent Signs Copies Of His New Book 'The 50th Law'|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1621181/50-cent-signs-copies-his-new-book-50th-law.jhtml|publisher=MTV News|date=September 10, 2009}}</ref><ref name=DailyTelegraph>{{cite news|last=Gora|first=Bronwen|title=Stars with the Midas touch|url=http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/entertainment/insider/stars-with-the-midas-touch/story-e6frewt9-1225797718279|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|date=November 14, 2009}}</ref> In promotion of the book, Greene and 50 Cent appeared on ''[[The Today Show]]'', [[CNBC]], [[American Broadcasting Company|ABC]], [[BBC]] and [[MTV News]].<ref name=CNBC/><ref name="MTVnews"/><ref name=TodayShow>{{cite web|title=50 Cent On The Today Show for supporting his new book "The 50th Law"|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e52S-lgtRq0|publisher=The Today Show|date=October 1, 2009}}</ref><ref name=ABCNews>{{cite web|title=The 50 Cent Empire|url=http://abcnews.go.com/video/playerindex?id=9001375|publisher=ABC News|date=November 5, 2009}}</ref><ref name=ABC7>{{cite web|title=Guest List: 50 Cent|url=http://abclocal.go.com/wls/story?section=resources&id=7104591|publisher=ABC|date=November 9, 2009}}</ref><ref name=BBC>{{cite web|title=50 Cent Speaks On Different Types Of Fear|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bbiLRFjvoNI#!|publisher=BBC|date=August 28, 2010}}</ref><ref name=BusinessInsider2>{{cite news|last=Saint|first=Nick|title=Get Rich Or Die Tryin': 50 Cent's Guide To Success|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/get-rich-or-die-tryin-50-cents-guide-to-success-2009-9|newspaper=Business Insider|date=September 16, 2009}}</ref> ''The 50th Law'' was also published as a 60-page [[comic book]].<ref name=ComicBook>{{cite web|last=Coleman|first=C. Vernon|title=50 Cent Making "SmartComic" Version of "The 50th Law"|url=http://hiphopwired.com/2011/07/25/50-cent-making-%E2%80%9Csmartcomic%E2%80%9D-version-of-%E2%80%9Cthe-50th-law%E2%80%9D/|publisher=Hip Hop Wired|date=July 25, 2011|access-date=2012-10-03|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111107170804/http://hiphopwired.com/2011/07/25/50-cent-making-%e2%80%9csmartcomic%e2%80%9d-version-of-%e2%80%9cthe-50th-law%e2%80%9d/|archive-date=2011-11-07|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref><ref name=XXL>{{cite web|title=XXL Quick Hitters: 50 Cent, Shyne, Diddy and The Weekend, Just Blaze And Saigon|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2012/05/xxl-quick-hitters-50-cent-shyne-diddy-and-the-weekend-just-blaze-and-saigon/|publisher=XXL|date=May 29, 2012}}</ref>

{{Infobox book | name = The Strategy Paradox | title_orig = | translator = | image = The-Strategy-Paradox-Cover.jpg | caption = Cover of ''The Strategy Paradox'' | author = [[Michael E. Raynor]] | illustrator = | cover_artist = | country = United States | language = English | series = | genre = [[Business|Business & Economics]] [[Management]] | publisher = [[Doubleday (publisher)|Doubleday]] | release_date = 2007 | english_release_date = | media_type = | pages = 320 pp | isbn = 978-0-385-51622-8 | isbn_note = (0-385-51622-3) | dewey= 658.4/012 22 | congress= HD30.28 .R384 2007 | oclc= 70778348 | preceded_by = | followed_by = }} '''''The Strategy Paradox''''' is a [[business strategy]] book by author [[Michael E. Raynor]], who is the Distinguished Fellow with [[Deloitte]] Research. ''The Strategy Paradox'' was published in 2007 by [[Doubleday (publisher)|Currency/Doubleday]]. It was named a top ten book of 2007 by ''[[BusinessWeek]]'',<ref>http://images.businessweek.com/ss/07/11/1130_business_books/index_01.htm</ref> and a top five strategy book of 2007 by ''Strategy+Business''.<ref>http://www.strategy-business.com/press/article/07408c?pg=1</ref>
==Synopsis==
''The Strategy Paradox'', the title and focus of the book sets up a ubiquitous but little-understood tradeoff. The tradeoff is that most strategies are built on specific beliefs about an unpredictable future, but current strategic approaches force leaders to commit to an inflexible strategy regardless of how the future might unfold. It is this commitment to uncertainty that is the cause of "the strategy paradox."
==Reviews==
*''National Post'' '''With the right strategy, you can take big risks and win.''' By John Worsley Simpson, Financial Post [http://www.canada.com/nationalpost/story.html?id=0e464e31-a96c-448b-aeff-7053d7e9a595] *''BusinessWeek'' '''Sidstepping Disaster.''' By Dean Foust [http://www.businessweek.com/magazine/content/07_12/b4026106.htm?chan=search] *''The Financial Times'' '''Take a strategic risk but hedge your bets.''' By Fergal Byrne [http://www.ft.com/cms/s/f53891f0-cc50-11db-a661-000b5df10621.html] *''Boston Globe'' '''For CEOs, admitting uncertainty can be the key to success.''' By Robert Weisman [http://www.boston.com/business/globe/articles/2007/07/01/for_ceos_admitting_uncertainty_can_be_the_key_to_success/] *''Harvard Business Review'' By Anand P. Raman [http://harvardbusinessonline.hbsp.harvard.edu/hbsp/hbr/articles/article.jsp?_requestid=36546&ml_subscriber=true&ml_action=get-article&ml_issueid=BR0705&articleID=BooksInBrief&pageNumber=1]

[[File:Tullio Liblik.jpg|thumb|Tullio Liblik]] '''Tullio Liblik''' (born November 12, 1964 in [[Kuressaare]]) is an Estonian entrepreneur, the CEO and member of the board of the investment company [[Saarte Investeering]] and the chairman of the council of Kuressaare Regional Training Centre.
==Education==
*1984 [[Jäneda]] [[Sovkhoz]]-technicum, [[agronomy]] *1988 [[Estonian University of Life Sciences]], economics and organizing of agriculture
==Career==
*1988–1991 [[Pihtla]] [[kolkhoz]], vice-chairman *1991–2001 Alliance of Saare Manufacturers, advisor of foreign trade *Since 1992 [[Estonian Chamber of Commerce and Industry]], chairman of the Saaremaa Office *1993–1999 AS Ösel Foods, member of the board *1999–2001 AS Ösel Foods, chairman of the board *Since 2001 OÜ Saarte Investeering, member of the board *2001–2008 AS Kuressaare Sanatoorium, member of the board *Since 2002 OÜ Roheline Ring, member of the board *2003– 2008 Saaremaa Golf, member of the board *2005–2011 AS E-Profiil, chairman of the board *Since 2005 OÜ A&A Kinnisvara Saaremaa, member of the board *2005–2008 OÜ Paldiski Wind Farm, chairman of the board *Since 2007 OÜ Energiamaja, member of the board *Since 2009 OÜ Energiamaja Konsultatsioonid, member of the board
Tullio Liblik made his first step into the business world in 1993 when he founded AS Ösel Foods in cooperation with Toivo Alt and Carl-Erik Sunblad.<ref>[http://www.ap3.ee/?PublicationId=31503ED6-39D4-4163-9D98-74AA1E3959CE&code=37504 "Saarlased teevad ilma mandril"] Äripäev, 10. veebruar 1999.</ref> AS Ösel Foods specialized on the manufacturing of soft drinks. For raw material supply they also founded AS Marjakasvatus which specialized in the growing of strawberries. In 1997 Ösel Foods grew its business to Russia. In a factory owned by Ösel Food in Moscow, they started to produce ketchup. In 1999 they bought Paljassaare Fish Industry, from the Norwegians, which produced fish sticks. Tullio Liblik exited the food industry in 2001 when he sold his stocks of AS Ösel Foods to Carl-Erik Sunblad.
In the same year Tullio Liblik founded the company Saarte Investeering, that specializes in real estate development and business consultations. The biggest real estate developments of Saarte Investeering are Merikotka housing estate in Kuressaare,<ref>[http://www.saartehaal.ee/2006/12/12/kuressaares-jatkub-aktiivne-elamuehitus "Kuressaares jätkub aktiivne elamuehitus"] Saarte Hääl, 12.detsember 2006.</ref> Hirvepargi housing estate in Sauga, Pärnu county<ref>[http://wwx.parnupostimees.ee/120607/parnuparnumaa/10075470.php "Saugas avati pidulikult Hirvepargi elamurajoon"] {{Webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20130620130521/http://wwx.parnupostimees.ee/120607/parnuparnumaa/10075470.php |date=2013-06-20 }} Pärnu Postimees, 12. juuni 2007.</ref> and four multistorey buildings in the city centre of [[Tallinn]]. Saarte Investeering has led real estate developments in Saaremaa, Kuressaare,<ref>[http://majandus.delfi.ee/news/uudised/tullio-liblik-rajab-kuressaarde-villad.d?id=18756147 "Tullio Liblik rajab Kuressaarde villad] Delfi Majandus, 25. April 2008.</ref><ref>[http://ehitusinfo.ee/index.php?aid=5798 "Tullio Liblik rajab Kuressaare golfiväljaku äärde ülikallid villad"] Ehitusinfo.ee.</ref> in [[Tallinn]] and in Sauga parish in Pärnu county.<ref>[http://äripäev.ee/?PublicationId=0ccf107d-fc8f-46d8-b1b2-5b8ca479a96b "Tullio Liblik rajas Sauga vallale tasuta infrastruktuurid"] Äripäev, 7. juuni 2007.</ref> Saarte Investeering has contributed the most to dwelling construction. Many other enterprises founded by Tullio Liblik, such as Saaremaa’s office of the real estate bureau OÜ A&A Kinnisvara and OÜ Energiamaja Konsultatsioonid, are also operating in real estate developing. In 2013 OÜ Energiamaja, that specializes in the construction of low-energy houses, started the housing development of 407 terraced houses in [[Peetri, Harju County|Peetri]] village in Rae parish, Harju county.
In 2001 Tullio Liblik founded OÜ Roheline Ring and participated in the founding of Estonia’s first [[wind farm]].<ref>[http://www.virtsu.ee/artiklid/2002_10_11a.html "Virtsus alustab tööd Eesti esimene tuulepark"] www.virtsu.ee; [[Eesti Energia]] pressiteade, 11. oktoober 2002.</ref> In 2002 a wind farm, consisting of three wind turbines, started to operate in [[Virtsu]]<ref>[http://www.virtsu.ee/artiklid/2002_10_12b.html "Virtsu tuulikud annavad poole taastuvenergiast"] www.virtsu.ee; Postimees, 12. oktoober 2002.</ref> with a total capacity of 1,8 MW of power. Two wind turbines out of three were owned by Roheline Ring and one by [[Eesti Energia]]. In 2005 Roheline Ring installed a wind farm of four wind turbines with a total capacity of 8 MW in [[Lääne County]], Rõuste. Via the investment company Saarte Investeering, Tullio Liblik was also a stakeholder of [[Paldiski]] wind farm. Altogether, he has participated in the construction of five wind farms<ref>[http://uudised.err.ee/index.php?0572843 "Tullio Liblik rajab koos Mõisa ja Tamjärvega kolm tuuleparki"] ERR, 30. märts 2007.</ref> that operate up to the present time. In 2007 Tullio Liblik sold his shares of the wind farms.<ref>[http://www.saartehaal.ee/2008/03/26/tullio-liblik-ja-ants-ink-muusid-maha-virtsu-ja-rouste-tuulepargi/ "Tullio Liblik ja Ants Ink müüsid maha Virtsu ja Rõuste tuulepargi"] Saarte Hääl, 26. märts 2008.</ref>
In 2005 the investment company Saarte Investeering, owned by Tullio Liblik, acquired the lion’s share in E-Profiil, a company manufacturing large steel structures.<ref>[http://www.epl.ee/news/majandus/tullio-liblik-toodab-nafta-tootmise-seadmeid.d?id=51060662 "Tullio Liblik toodab nafta tootmise seadmeid"] Eesti Päevaleht, 18. oktoober 2006.</ref> In 2011 Liblik sold his shares of the company E-Profiil.<ref>[http://majandus.delfi.ee/news/uudised/tullio-liblik-muus-metallifirma-aripartnerile.d?id=59142866 "Tullio Liblik müüs metallifirma äripartnerile"] Delfi Majandus, 5. oktoober 2011.</ref>
Since 2002 Tullio Liblik has been the member of the council of Kuressaare Regional Training Centre, and has also been voted for the chairman of the council. In 2007 Tullio Liblik became the member of the Estonian Association for Advancement of Vocational Education and has been active in informing the vocational education leaders about the expectations of entrepreneurs. As the chairman of the council of Kuressaare Regional Training Centre he has initiated various educational projects and has been developing the Training Centre’s international cooperation.
==Social Activity== *Since 1992 Saaremaa [[Rotary International|Rotary Club]], member *Since 2002 Kuressaare Regional Training Centre, chairman of the council *2002–2005 Kuressaare Town Hall, member, chairman of the audit commission *Since 2007 Estonian Association for Advancement of Vocational Education, member *Since 2008 Football Club Saaremaa FC aaMeraaS, president *Since 2010 Association of Saare Country Entrepreneurs, member of the board *Since 2012 Development Chamber of Saare County, member
===Supporting Successful Pupils=== In 2007-2011 OÜ Saarte Investeering supported the pupils and their tutors of Saare county<ref>[http://www.aripaev.eu/?PublicationId=f16cf4c5-d9cd-4874-9386-e376679086e4 "Tullio Liblik premeerib Saaremaa parimaid õpilasi ja õpetajaid"] Äripäev, 16. April 2007</ref> who had achieved spectacular results in Estonian and international olympiads and national exams. Year by year Saarte Investeering has added new entrepreneurs in the supporters’ circle of the successful pupils,<ref>[http://www.saartehaal.ee/2011/04/07/maavalitsus-toetab-koos-ettevotjatega-tublisid-opilasi/ "Maavalitsus toetab koos ettevõtjatega tublisid õpilasi"] Saarte Hääl, 7. April 2001.</ref> who are proceeding with the support project up to the present time.
Since 2010 Saarte Investeering has supported the Graduate of the Year of Kuressaare Adults’ Gymnasium with a scholarship. Starting from the same year, he has also been the main sponsor of the Football championship of Saare County.<ref>[http://www.saartehaal.ee/2010/12/28/tullio-liblik-asus-jalgpalliklubi-etteotsa/ "Tullio Liblik asus jalgpalliklubi etteotsa"] Saarte Hääl, 28. detsember 2010</ref>
In 2012 Saarte Investeering signed a cooperation contract with Kuressaare Regional Training Centre. According to the contract, every five years Saarte Investeering awards one graduate of Kuressaare Regional Training Centre with a scholarship,<ref>[http://www.saartehaal.ee/2012/11/07/juubelit-tahistava-ametikooli-vilistlane-sai-vaarika-stipendiumi/ "Juubelit tähistava ametikooli vilistlane sai väärika stipendiumi (FOTOD)"] Saarte Hääl, 7. november 2012</ref><ref>[https://www.meiemaa.ee/index.php?content=artiklid&sub=1&artid=50386 "Ametikooli edasiõppija esimese stipendiumi pälvis Andres Talk"] Meie Maa, 7. november 2012</ref> who will proceed to acquire a higher education in the same field in Estonia or abroad.
At the acknowledgement event ’’Eestimaa õpib ja tänab’’ held in 2011, SA Innove in cooperation with Estonian Ministry of Education and Research and Estonian Education Personnel Union acknowledged the CEO of Saarte Investeering, Tullio Liblik as the ’best friend and supporter of education’ in Saare County region.
==Land Swap Case== In 2005, motivated by an article that was published in Eesti Ekspress, an investigation of the entitlement and possible corruption factors concerning the swap of rural land properties under nature conservation protection was started. In 2009 the Office of the Prosecutor General brought charges to the partakers of the Land Swap Case. Tullio Liblik was accused of bribing. Besides Liblik two members of [[Riigikogu]], Villu Reiljan and Ester Tuiksoo, businessmen Toomas Annus, Einar Vettus and Tarmo Pedjasaar, also Kalev Kangur, the former Director General of Estonian Land Board, and corporate bodies AS Järvevana and AS E.L.L. Kinnisvara were accused.
In 2012, Harju County Court acquitted all the defendants of the Land Swap Case of<ref>[http://news.err.ee/Politics/0413fd4f-5a06-440a-9392-28e7fd56306a "All Defendants in Land Swap Case Acquitted "] ERR, June 19, 2012.</ref> and ordered the state to pay court costs of the defendats.<ref>[http://www.delfi.ee/news/paevauudised/110_112/riik-peab-lisaks-13-miljonile-huvitama-ka-tuhandete-eurode-eest-maadevahetuses-suudistatute-vabadusekaotuse.d?id=64564310 "Riik peab lisaks 1,3 miljonile hüvitama ka tuhandete eurode eest maadevahetuses süüdistatute vabadusekaotuse"] Delfi, 19. juuni 2012.</ref>
==Business Argument with Sukles== Saarte Investeering and MaxKinnisvara started their cooperation in 2004 in order to construct the Hirvepargi housing development in Sauga parish, Pärnu County. By the year 2007 twelve houses had been erected when the project needed additional financing to proceed with the construction. The owners of MaxKinnisvara didn’t want to add any more money to the initial investment of 20,000 euros and, as a consequence, disagreements arose between the partners.
Ongoing disagreements resulted in ordering a hit in 2010.<ref>[http://www.ekspress.ee/news/paevauudised/eestiuudised/kahtlustus-palgamorvar-pidi-tapma-tullio-libliku.d?id=32804277 "Kahtlustus: palgamõrvar pidi tapma Tullio Libliku"] Eesti Ekspress, 27. august 2010.</ref>
The police managed to prevent the hit<ref>[http://www.delfi.ee/news/paevauudised/110_112/tullio-libliku-advokaat-politsei-hoidis-tapmise-ara.d?id=65498340 "Tullio Libliku advokaat: politsei hoidis tapmise ära"] Delfi, 7. jaanuar 2013.</ref><ref>[http://www.delfi.ee/news/paevauudised/eesti/palgamorvast-paasenud-liblik-meil-oli-raha-liiga-vahe.d?id=32901359 "Palgamõrvast pääsenud Liblik: meil oli raha liiga vähe!"] Delfi, 2. september 2010</ref> and Andrus Sukles was arrested.
Harju County Court found that Sukles wished to kill his former business partner and also made preparations to achieve that. However, Sukles was acquitted.<ref>[http://news.err.ee/cfbd3658-e036-44ea-8106-5c563e8114af " Businessman Had Intent to Kill, but Cleared of Attempting to Order Hit"] ERR, January 7, 2013.</ref>
==Hobbies== *'''Reading'''<ref>[http://www.saartehaal.ee/2012/03/26/arimees-tullio-libliku-ookapil-ei-ole-ainult-majandusraamatud/ Ärimees Tullio Libliku öökapil ei ole ainult majandusraamatud] Saarte Hääl, 26. märts 2012</ref> *'''Cigar Culture''' Since 2012 Tullio Liblik is a member of the board of Tallinn Cigar Club
*'''Alpine Skiing'''
==Personal== Tullio Liblik is the first child of her mother.

{{navy|Germany}} | casualties1 = 1 fishing vessel captured | casualties2 = 1 fishing vessel captured | casualties3 = | notes = | title = Turbot War | causes = Fishing rights dispute between Canada and Spain | casualties_label = }} The '''Turbot War''' (known in Spain as '''Guerra del Fletán''') was an international fishing dispute between [[Canada]] (supported by the [[United Kingdom]] and [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]]) and [[Spain]] (supported by the [[European Union]] and [[Iceland]]) in which Canada stopped a Spanish [[fishing trawler]] from [[Galicia (Spain)|Galicia]] in [[international waters]] and arrested its crew. Canada claimed that European Union [[factory ship]]s were illegally [[overfishing]] [[Greenland halibut]], also known as Greenland turbot, on the [[Grand Banks of Newfoundland|Grand Banks]], just outside Canada's declared {{convert|200|nmi|km|adj=on}} [[exclusive economic zone]] (EEZ). ==Prelude== Territorial seas have changed over time, having begun with a {{convert|3|nmi|km|lk=in|adj=on}} "cannon shot" territorial sea, followed by the long-standing extension to a {{convert|12|nmi|km|adj=on}} standard. The economic control of the waters surrounding nations to a {{convert|200|nmi|km|adj=on}} [[exclusive economic zone]]s (EEZ) were agreed at the conference on the [[Third United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea]] in 1982, and became recognised internationally on November 14, 1994. As a self-governing colony and dominion, [[Newfoundland and Labrador|Newfoundland]]'s foreign policy, just as Canada's, was established by the British government until the [[Statute of Westminster 1931]]. However, in 1934, Newfoundland's government voted to be put under the administration of a commission appointed by London; this situation remained until 1949 when the dominion entered [[Canadian Confederation]]. Following Confederation, Canada recognized many of the foreign policy agreements Newfoundland had entered under this commission. During the 1950s to the 1970s, the domestic and foreign fishing fleets became increasingly [[Fishing industry|industrialized]], with massive [[factory freezer trawlers]] fishing out of Newfoundland ports – foreign fleets were based in Newfoundland and could fish 12 nautical miles offshore, while domestic fleets could fish in both the territorial sea and the offshore. By the 1970s the overfishing by industrial vessels in the waters of the other provinces of eastern Canada was evident, although each subsequent federal government continued to ignore this problem, and even contributed to it by using the issuance of fishing licenses for more inshore and offshore domestic vessels. Between 1973 and 1982 the [[United Nations]] and its member states negotiated the Third Convention of the [[United Nations Convention on the Law of the Sea|Law of the Sea]] – one component of which was the concept of nations being allowed to declare an EEZ. Although not adopted into international law until 1982, the possibility of declaring an EEZ became a ''de facto'' reality in 1977 with the conclusion of those sections of the Third Conference negotiations relating to [[maritime boundary]] and economic control. Many nations worldwide declared 200-nautical-mile EEZs, including Canada and the United States. The EEZ boundaries became a foreign policy issue where overlapping claims existed, as was the case between Canada and the United States in the [[Gulf of Maine]], [[Dixon Entrance]], [[Strait of Juan de Fuca]] and [[Beaufort Sea]], as well as between Canada and [[France]] in the case of [[St. Pierre and Miquelon]]. But on the whole, for fishermen in eastern Canada, it meant they could fish unhindered out to the limit without fear of competing with the foreign fleets. During the late 1970s and early 1980s, Canada's domestic offshore fleet grew as fishermen and [[fish processing]] companies rushed to take advantage. It was also during this time when it was noticed that the foreign fleets now pushed out to 200 nautical miles offshore and excluded from the rich Canadian waters, were increasing their harvest on the small areas of the [[Grand Banks]] that were outside the area of the EEZ. By the late 1980s the smaller catches of [[Atlantic cod|Northern cod]] were being reported throughout the Atlantic coast of Canada as the federal government and citizens of coastal regions in the area began to face the reality that the domestic and foreign overfishing had taken its toll. In the end stocks of cod in and around Canada's EEZ were severely depleted. Reluctant to act at a time of declining political popularity, the federal government was finally forced to take drastic action in 1992 when a [[Collapse of the Atlantic northwest cod fishery|total moratorium]] was declared indefinitely for the Northern Cod. The immediate impact was felt most in Newfoundland, followed by the Atlantic coast of [[Nova Scotia]]. The nascent [[Northwest Atlantic Fisheries Organization]], organized after the 1977 EEZ declarations to coordinate conservation efforts in Canada, the United States, and member nations in Europe (both western and eastern bloc countries), also declared a ban, however it was implemented too late to be effective – cod which 5–10 years before was being caught in record numbers, had vanished almost overnight to the point where it was considered for [[endangered species]] protection. The economic impact in coastal Newfoundland was unprecedented. To lessen the impact that its policies of permitting overfishing had exacted upon rural Newfoundlanders, the federal government swiftly created a relief program called "The Atlantic Groundfish Strategy" (TAGS) to provide short- to medium-term financial support, and employment retraining for the longer term. Despite TAGS, Newfoundland and coastal Nova Scotia were bleeding severely as communities began to experience an out-migration on a scale not seen in Canada since the prairie [[dust bowl]]s of the 1930s. The anger at federal political figures was palpable and with the wholesale rejection of short-term Prime Minister [[Kim Campbell]], incoming prime minister [[Jean Chrétien]]'s [[Liberal Party of Canada|Liberals]] were going to face the ongoing wrath of voters whose entire livelihoods had been decimated as a result of decades of federal neglect and mismanagement, and whose communities, property values, net worth, and way of life were declining rapidly. [[File:briantobin.jpg|thumb|left|[[Brian Tobin]] was the Canadian politician who was largely responsible for managing the conflict. This earned him the nicknames 'Captain Canada' and 'The Turbotonator'{{cite news |url=http://www.cbc.ca/canada/story/2005/07/27/Turbot-Estai-050727.html |work=CBC News |title=Court backs Canada's seizure of trawler during 'turbot war' |date=July 27, 2005 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090714191626/http://www.cbc.ca/canada/story/2005/07/27/Turbot-Estai-050727.html |archivedate=2009-07-14 |df= }}]] In the years since the cod moratorium, federal fisheries policy makers and scientists had scrambled to attempt to find a replacement species that could at least reinject economic stimulus into the affected regions. The ground fishery, while a fraction of what it had been during the cod years, did have some bright spots – one of which was the Greenland halibut commonly known in Canada as turbot. The turbot had decreased in demand due to a common dislike for the taste in the European Union. Canada was not alone in recognizing the growing value of the turbot, and foreign fishing fleets operating off the 200-nautical-mile EEZ were beginning to pursue the species in increasing numbers. By 1994, Canada and NAFO had tracked about 50 violations of boats crossing the 200-nautical-mile EEZ limit to fish illegally within Canadian waters, as well as recording use of illegal gear and overfishing outside Canadian waters. The new federal [[Minister of Fisheries and Oceans (Canada)|Minister of Fisheries and Oceans]], [[Brian Tobin]], directed the [[Department of Fisheries and Oceans (Canada)|Department of Fisheries and Oceans]] (DFO), along with the [[Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade (Canada)|Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade]] (DFAIT) to begin a very aggressive dialogue with the [[European Union]] over the presence of its fishing fleet and its practices, particularly the use of illegal trawl nets just outside the Canadian EEZ while fishing for turbot. Tobin's critics in Canada noted that he was likely using his department as a political prop to shore up support during a time of increased social unrest in the region, yet in the winter of 1995, Tobin directed DFO to establish a legal argument which could be made for the seizure of a foreign vessel in international waters using the premise of conservation. ==The ''Estai'' incident== Minister Tobin and the federal cabinet then told the DFO to demonstrate Canadian resolve on the issue by "making an example" of a European Union fishing vessel. On 9 March 1995, an offshore patrol aircraft detected the Spanish stern trawler ''Estai'' in international waters outside Canada's 200-nautical-mile EEZ. Armed DFO fisheries patrol vessels, Cape Roger, Leonard J. Cowley and [[Canadian Coast Guard]] Ship Sir Wilfred Grenfell, intercepted and pursued ''Estai'', which cut its weighted trawl net and fled after an initial boarding attempt, resulting in a several hours' chase which ended after the Canadian Fisheries Patrol vessel ''Cape Roger'' fired a .50 calibre (12.7 mm) machine gun across the [[Bow (ship)|bow]] of ''Estai''. The Canadian Coast Guard ship {{ship|CCGS|Sir Wilfred Grenfell||2}} used high-pressure fire-fighting [[water cannon]] to deter other Spanish fishing vessels from disrupting the operation. Finally, armed DFO Fishery Officers and [[Royal Canadian Mounted Police]] (RCMP) officers boarded ''Estai'' in international waters on the Grand Banks. ''Estai'' was escorted to [[St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador|St. John's]], arriving with great [[fanfare]] across the province and region — and the country. Canada's [[Federal Court of Canada|federal court]] processed the case and the charges against the crew while Spain and the European Union protested vehemently, threatening boycotts against Canada and wishing to have the case heard at the [[International Court of Justice]]. Tobin and his department ignored the controversy and instead had the oversized trawl net which ''Estai'' had cut free salvaged. The DFO contracted a Fishery Products International ground fish trawler to drag for ''Estai''{{'}}s trawl. On the first attempt it retrieved the ''Estai''{{'}}s net which had been cut. It was found that ''Estai'' was using a liner with a mesh size smaller than permitted by the Northwest Atlantic Fisheries Organisation (NAFO). The net was shipped to [[New York City]] where Tobin called an international press conference on board a rented [[barge]] in the [[East River]] outside the [[United Nations]] headquarters. There, the net from ''Estai'' was displayed, hanging from an enormous crane, and Tobin used the occasion to shame the Spanish and EU governments, pointing out the small size of the holes in the net which are illegal in Canada. Spain never denied that the net was from ''Estai'' but continued to protest Canada's use of "extra-territorial force". The Spanish government asked the International Court of Justice in The Hague, Netherlands, for leave to hear a case claiming that Canada had no right to detain ''Estai''. However, the court later refused the case.{{cite web |url=http://www.icj-cij.org/docket/files/96/7533.pdf |title=Fisheries Jurisdiction (Spain v. Canada), Jurisdiction of the Court, Judgment, I. C.J. Reports 1998 |date=1998 |publisher=International Court of Justice |issn=0074-4441 |pages=432}} Later, Canada released the crew of ''Estai''. On the same day that Tobin was in New York, the United Kingdom blocked an EU proposal to impose sanctions on Canada. Tobin claimed that Canada would not enter negotiations as long as illegal fishing continued, and demanded the withdrawal of all fishing vessels in the area as a precondition. On March 15, the owners of ''Estai'' posted $500,000 bond for the vessel, and it was returned to Spain. Subsequently, the rest of the fishing fleet also left the area, and preliminary talks were scheduled for the upcoming [[G7]] conference. These talks failed, as the Spanish refused to change their position, and Spanish fishing vessels subsequently returned to Grand Banks. Spain also implemented a visa mandate for all Canadians visiting, or planning to visit Spain. This resulted in several Canadians being deported from Spain who had been legally in Spain up until the moment the visa mandate was adopted.{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1995/03/15/news/15iht-fish_3.html |title=Madrid Sets Visa Rules And Calls for Vessels To Start Fishing Again : Spain Steps Up Pressure on Canada in Boat Dispute |newspaper=The New York Times |last=Buerkle |first=Tom |date=15 March 1995 |accessdate=15 December 2016}} The visa mandate was later overturned by the EU in 1996. The [[Spanish Navy]] deployed the {{sclass-|Serviola|patrol boat}} ''Atalaya'' to protect its country's fishing vessels. The Spanish Navy also prepared a surface task group with frigates and tankers, but Spain eventually decided against sending it. Negotiations ceased on March 25, and the following day, Canadian ships cut the nets of the Spanish trawler ''Pescamero Uno''. The Spanish Navy responded by deploying a second patrol boat. Canadian warships and patrol planes in the vicinity were authorized by Canadian Prime Minister Jean Chrétien to fire on Spanish vessels that exposed their guns. Direct negotiations between the EU and Canada eventually restarted, and a deal was reached on April 5. Spain, however, rejected it, demanding better terms. After Canada threatened to forcibly remove Spanish fishing vessels, the EU pressured Spain into finally reaching a settlement on April 15. Canada reimbursed the $500,000 that had been paid for ''Estai''{{'}}s release, repealed the CFPR provision that allowed the arrest of Spanish vessels, and a reduction of Canada's own Turbot allocation. A new international regime to observe EU and Canadian fishing vessels was also created.[http://www.cda-cdai.ca/cdai/uploads/cdai/2009/04/sneyd05.pdf cda-cdai.ca: "Fighting over fish: A look at the 1995 Canada-Spain Turbot War"]{{Dead link|date=July 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=no }} (Sneyd, 2005) The dispute raised Brian Tobin's political profile, helping to preserve his political career in Newfoundland at a time when federal politicians were being increasingly vilified. It also led to his decision in 1996 to pursue to the leadership of the [[Liberal Party of Newfoundland and Labrador|Liberal Party of Newfoundland]] following the resignation of [[List of Newfoundland and Labrador premiers|premier]] [[Clyde Wells]], as well as a widely discussed future possibility for leadership of the [[Liberal Party of Canada]]. ==The ''Newlyn'' incident== Although Spain was getting political support from the EU (including naval support from Germany among others), the United Kingdom and [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] supported Canada.[http://www.thecanadianencyclopedia.ca/en/article/fish-war-ends/ thecanadianencyclopedia.ca "Fish War Ends"](reprint of a 24 April 1995 article from [[Maclean's]]) The then prime-minister [[John Major]] risked his status within the EU community by actively speaking out against Spain. Because of this, some British fishing boats took to flying Canadian flags to show their support. This brought the conflict to European waters when a [[Cornwall|Cornish]] fishing boat, ''Newlyn'', then flying the Canadian flag, was arrested by a French ship that believed it to be Canadian. This dragged Britain from its position of passive backing into full support of the Canadians. Overnight, Canadian flags began to fly from all manner of British and Irish vessels.[http://base.d-p-h.info/fr/fiches/premierdph/fiche-premierdph-3975.html "The Turbot War – UK and Ireland support Canada"] (Sharma, ICSF) The rest of the EU rallied behind France and Spain, but hesitated to make any mobilizations against the British, Irish, or Canadians. Upon hearing the news of the conflict, [[Iceland]] spoke up and took the side of the EU against Britain in light of their similar clash with the British, known as the [[Cod Wars]]. As with the EU, no military mobilization took place. Iceland tried to put political pressure on the United Kingdom and Ireland.[https://www.jstor.org/pss/3551905 "The Canada-European Union Turbot War: A Brief Game Theoretic Analysis"] by Missios and Plourde (Canadian Public Policy Journal, Vol. 22, No. 2 Jun., 1996, pp. 144–150) The British and the Irish pointedly ignored these actions and continued their unquestioned support of Brian Tobin and the Canadians. In the end ''Newlyn'' was returned to the British without further incident. ==See also== *[[1993 Cherbourg incident]] *[[Cod Wars]] *[[Lobster War]] ==References== ===Footnotes=== {{Reflist|30em}} ===Works cited=== {{refbegin}} *Barry, Donald, Applebaum, Bob, and Wiseman, Earl (2014). La voz de Galicia] {{es}} *[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3RWP-a01hSs&context=C3515b35UDOEgsToPDskIEVWGB45N3BaJLFDFUSiLk For Cod and Country] Spoof song based on Turbot War performed by Cultus Cod at Spring Scream 1995, Kenting, Taiwan. {{fishing history}} {{1995 shipwrecks}} [[Category:Military history of Newfoundland and Labrador]] [[Category:Law of the sea]] [[Category:1995 in Canada]] [[Category:1995 in Spain]] [[Category:History of fishing]] [[Category:Battles and conflicts without fatalities]] [[Category:Maritime incidents in 1995]] [[Category:Conflicts in 1995]] [[Category:Maritime incidents in 1996]] [[Category:Fishing conflicts]] [[Category:Fisheries law]] [[Category:Fishing in Canada]] [[Category:International maritime incidents]] [[Category:1990s in Newfoundland and Labrador]]
